programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A woman searches for a new home in Alicante, Spain, with a budget of 120,000 euros, while Daniel and Margaret from Glasgow look for a property near to the coast in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps Pauline and her daughter Rebecca sell their run-down semi in Braunstone Town, Leicestershire.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cooking contest moves to Lincolnshire, with former soldier Scott and partner Clare kicking off the week, followed by Su and Dylan, and ending with ex-army couple Adele and Dave.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, married couple Karen and Nigel kick off the competition with a Bajan-themed menu, followed by Beth and Clem's meal, and Jo and Charlie's Greek night.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kent couple Chris and Sue, who are struggling to decide whether to downsize locally in Royal Tunbridge Wells, or make a completely new start in life by moving to the south of France. With this in mind, she demonstrates what their budget could buy them on the Cote d'Azur.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: The Victorian category comes into focus as Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present more building restorations in the running for the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Restoration of the Year award. Anna explores Mount Stewart, an imposing country house in Northern Ireland, and Wilton's Music Hall in east London. Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle visits the Pump House in Barry, Wales, and historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr looks round a medieval-style castle in Stornoway in the Scottish Highlands. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: Flashy Funerals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of the UK's most extraordinary final goodbyes, meeting families who go above and beyond to ensure their loved ones go out in style. With access to some of Britain's leading funeral directors, the programme explores the challenges they face as they organise some of the biggest funerals of their careers, pulling out all the stops, with just one chance to get it right.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller treats an elderly cat with a worrying lump in its abdomen, while an overweight dog is limping badly and needs an operation to save its damaged knee.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Rhod Gilbert spend 48 hours in Florida's largest city, for a densely packed mini-break including art, art deco slobbing, alligators, yoga, speedboats and dominoes. They also squeeze in an airboat tour of the Florida Everglades and a trip to Little Havana.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sailing enthusiasts Andy and Dee look for a large holiday home in Spain, while a woman's insistence on bringing her pet parrot is complicating her property search in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits Reigate in Surrey, where retired couple Lenny and Mary are struggling to secure a sale on their home. Phil also heads to Haslemere, where he meets Kimberley, an estate agent who is struggling to sell her own home.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three East Sussex couples compete for the £1,000 prize, including one pair who divide up the cooking and the hosting, and another duo who cannot seem to stop bickering.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north east of England compete for the £1,000 prize - first up are loved-up musicians Nick and Kelly, followed by Matthew and Katie, and Michael and Becky.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps workaholics David and Karen who cannot decide whether to buy a place to escape to in Dorset or the alpine city of Graz in Austria. Jasmine reveals what their £130,000 budget will get them in both locations.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary examining an espionage operation conducted to gather information on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. Shown to mark the 80th anniversary of the king's abdication, the programmes examines recently declassified documents revealing the extent of the surveillance and who ordered it, as well as featuring dramatic reconstructions and eyewitness accounts.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Following on from a pilot edition shown last Christmas, the Gogglesprogs return for a six-part run in which they maintain a close eye on a range of TV output, from entertainment shows and documentaries to some all-time classic films and up-to-the-minute news stories. Participants include six-year-old Molly and her eight-year-old brother William who both love helping out on the family farm, Stephanie who adores Justin Bieber and her friend Christina who prefers classical music, and schoolmates Jacob and Connor. In this opening programme, the youngsters offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on The Undateables, Donald Trump and Mamma Mia!.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Primates of the Caribbean
programme.desc: A monkey who guards the beach of a Caribbean island is horrified to discover a tycoon plans to build a casino in the area. He soon learns this is just a cover for a far more evil scheme, and joins forces with a motley band of simian pirates to save his home from a giant robot. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jason J Lewis, Anthony Jenkins and Phil Meyers.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Couples planning the perfect wedding on benefits, including Middlesbrough couple Ellie and John, who are young and in love but out of work. John is eager to give his fiancee the white wedding she craves - but is such a thing possible on benefits? The programme also catches up with Michelle and Steven from Plymouth, who recently celebrated their first anniversary. Both too overweight to work, they continue their attempts to diet while living off the state. Plus, the story of Joanna and Andrew from Cwmbran, who combined all their benefits with a loan to pay for their wedding, which was shown live on Channel 5 in the summer of 2015.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City

programme.title: Sex Pod

programme.title: One Night With My Ex
programme.desc: Three lively sets of former couples spend one night together alone in a luxury apartment, and decide if they should get back together or continue to go their separate ways for good. This episode sees former partners Matt and Emma, Ronan and Nick, and Imogen and Ben confront their pasts and get to the heart of the issues in their previous relationships together.(n)

Meanwhile, Stewart and Iain receive more than just threats from the staff and owner of a taxi business, a car dealer has to choose between paying up or losing his showroom stars, and an Indian restaurant owner is in danger of losing his livelihood.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Marietta Swanne commends full-time carer Rosanne for looking after her 100-year-old mother Joan, who has advanced dementia. However, it becomes clear that providing 24/7 care is putting her under immense physical and mental strain. Meanwhile, Dr William Laird is consulted by Ebere, a young single mother and a victim of violence who is struggling with depression.(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house in this grimly efficient exercise in horror and suspense(n)

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Mickey Rourke is a fading pro-wrestler struggling to adjust to life outside the ring in this Oscar-winning 2008 movie. Marisa Tomei co-stars(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A killer cyborg is sent from the future to kill the mother of a would-be resistance leader(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Ted (voice of Seth MacFarlane) ties the knot with Tami-Lynn (Jessica Barth), and recruits his best friend John (Mark Wahlberg) as a sperm donor in order to start a family in this sequel to the comedy hit about a teddy bear come to life. Later, when the Commonwealth of Massachusetts demands that Ted appear before a judge to prove he's a real person, the frisky bear and his pal vow to fight for their civil rights. Morgan Freeman and Amanda Seyfried co-star(n)

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore plays a teenage single mother who tries to overcome the feeling she's made the wrong choices in life(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Dutch film producer Pieter Jan Brugge makes his directorial debut with the dramatic thriller The Clearing. Affluent executive Wayne Hayes (Robert Redford) and his lovely wife, Eileen (Helen Mirren), live in a beautiful home in Pittsburg. One day, Wayne is kidnapped by disgruntled employee Arnold Mack (Willem Dafoe). He is then held for ransom in a forest. Meanwhile, Eileen is forced to reckon with the FBI agents as they negotiate with the kidnapper. Alessandro Nivola and Melissa Sagemiller star as the two grown Hayes children. Matt Craven plays FBI Agent Ray Fuller. The Clearing premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2004(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kirsten Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: A madcap brain surgeon, married to a beautiful but evil woman, falls in love with the brain of another lady who has everything he wants - except a body(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Imported by the Army for an early a.m. radio show, Cronauer blasts the formerly staid, sanitized airwaves with a constant barrage of rapid-fire humor and the hottest hits from back home. The G.I.s love him but the brass is up in arms!(n)

programme.title: The Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Comedy about what happens when an unannounced, uninvited and unwelcome family of misfits converges upon a lakeside resort to join their relatives for a summer of relaxation(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: The comic tale of a young Asian woman who joins the local semi-professional football team but opts not to tell her traditionalist family, who want her to go to law school and settle down with a nice Indian boy. She finds it increasingly difficult to deal with her double life as a dutiful daughter and a talented footballer(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: This haunting psychological horror tale examines what happens when a respected astronaut returns to Earth after a near-fatal accident. His wife immediately senses that something is wrong and her fear is heightened when she subsequently becomes pregnant with twins. What exactly happened out there in the silence of space?(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Bob Hoskins star in Francis Ford Coppola's panorama of love, crime and entertainment in this stylish gangster film, centred on the legendary Harlem Nightclub. (1984)(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: As they await eviction from a Miami hotel, four retired mobsters try to scare off the other residents by making them an offer they can't refuse. Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss. Donatelli: Dan Hedaya. Donato: Seymour Cassel. Det. Neal: Carrie-Anne Moss. Ferris: Jennifer Tilly. Directed by Michael Dinner(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish and clever caper film starring Gerard Butler ("300") and Tom Wilkinson ("John Adams")(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Red Runway.
programme.desc: The detective tracks down a killer in New York's fashion scene, believing mistaken identity could be involved in the death of an assistant, and dons a designer outfit to go undercover at a fundraising event. Meanwhile, Jake questions Max's role in the office, with Laura fighting to keep him on. Comedy police drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A janitor is found murdered, leading the team to a schizophrenic student they discover has been part of an experimental drug programme. Though all evidence points to the youngster, it transpires that he had no motive to commit the crime and the police soon turn their attentions to a psychiatrist. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a crooked car dealer whose son is dying of leukaemia presents McCoy and Ross with a moral dilemma. His ex-wife is their prime suspect - but it transpires that the victim had regularly abused her and refused to pay child support. Drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the hunt for La Grenouille intensifies, Tony's cover is blown and his car is later destroyed in an explosion, leaving the team convinced he has been killed. However, Ducky's autopsy on the body of the driver reveals it was actually someone else who died in the blast.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Andy's romance with Callaghan becomes complicated as they disagree over how to handle a witness in a murder case. Meanwhile, the other rookies discover the shocking truth behind evidence from a fatal traffic collision.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Fateful Fire.
programme.desc: The detective is torn between solving a murderous arson case at an apartment block and baking for her twins' school's winter carnival. While Laura takes some time off to make her stall, fire investigator and Jake's ex Angela Ryan (guest star Anastasia Griffith) takes charge of the case. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Conclusion of a three-part story. The investigation into a movie studio boss's murder becomes further complicated when fresh evidence points to yet another suspect. Meanwhile, the ex-husband of the deceased goes to trial to face accusations of having a hand in the crime - is an innocent man about to be convicted? Sam Waterston stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Angell and Danny's search for the murderer of a security guard puts them on the trail of a master thief (guest star Nelly Furtado), who targets high-end department stores. Meanwhile, Mac, Sheldon and Flack investigate the death of a college student who wrote for his institution's newspaper, and learn the victim may have uncovered secrets that some people on campus would kill to keep protected.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. Memories of his murdered family lead him to make the case a priority, but he acts on his initiative and leaves HQ without his badge, making DiNozzo fear he is risking his job for a personal vendetta. Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A taxi driver and an admiral working at the Pentagon are found executed by the side of a road, but the agents have trouble ascertaining a motive - until they uncover links to a woman searching for her missing husband, a political refugee from Africa. Meanwhile, McGee makes a discovery about his new girlfriend. Starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Root goes undercover at a radio station, and after recovering from his injuries, Fusco decides that he has had enough and tells Finch that he is going to quit.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An emotionally disturbed man claims to have witnessed a rape in a hospital. Despite the witness's dubious credibility the SVU investigates, but the alleged victim denies being assaulted. Crime drama, guest starring Natasha Lyonne and Carrie Preston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a Romany boy proves difficult because of his community's distrust of outsiders. When detectives identify a neighbour as the prime suspect, it causes much distress within the close-knit group.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A blackout brings chaos to the neighbourhood after a drunk driver crashes into a power line, so the firefighters offer the locals refuge at the station, but the atmosphere is tense. Meanwhile, Clarke comes face to face with two armed robbers at a supermarket, Katie considers moving to New York for a job and Casey lies to Dawson about his headaches and memory loss.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Delko head to Rio de Janeiro to find Marisol's killer, Antonio Riaz. Back in Miami, Ryan reluctantly works with new CSI Natalia Boa Vista on an investigation into the murder of a woman found dead in her own home. David Caruso and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Casey loses his temper with Det Voight and the two men come to blows, while Dawson's career hangs in the balance after her questionable conduct on a call. Severide is unable to ignore his injured arm any longer when it fails him during a rescue operation, and he turns to old flame and drug rep Anna, hoping she will be able to alleviate his pain. American firefighting drama, starring Jesse Spencer, Taylor Kinney and Jason Beghe.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Art Ace.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of an art dealer in Manhattan's Little Korea, taking part in a seedy back-street poker game to find out more information about the murder, with the help of her father and his card game skills. Comedy drama, with Debra Messing and guest star Robert Klein.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of Richard Speigel, chief financial officer for an exclusive, family owned department store, results in the arrests of the shop staff - but the manager and father refuses to let his offspring take the blame, and goes all out to get them off the hook. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The case against a man accused of shooting the leader of the African-American Congress is jeopardised by the revelation that the prosecution's chief witness was once an informant for the FBI, and is still under their protection.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinise and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to the scene of a car accident in which a petty officer was killed. They discover a bullet wound in the body, as well as another victim at the bottom of a nearby ravine - a woman who was beaten to death. Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: A heatwave creates havoc in the city, forcing the rookies to work around the clock to keep the peace. Andy fears a serial rapist may have resurfaced and is preying on teenage girls, and a sudden blackout forces him to tackle the predator alone.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Deemed Dealer.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a teenage boy who is mown down by a car as he walks through a rough neighbourhood, believing his death could be related to dealing drugs, before digging deeper into the dead teen's life. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A carjacking turns nasty when an off-duty police officer is killed and the driver is kidnapped. Luckily, Briscoe and Curtis capture one of the perpetrators, who offers to reveal the whereabouts of the missing driver to DA Ross - in exchange for immunity on the cop-killing charge. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella fears she may have been infected with HIV-positive blood while conducting inquiries at a murder scene, and Danny investigates the case of a woman whose body has been found in a bath filled with water and rose petals, but has trouble establishing the cause of death. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby babysits a bright nine-year-old while the other members of the team try to locate the youngster's missing father - a survivalist wanted in connection with a case of robbery and murder. The search takes them deep into the wilderness - where a startling discovery awaits. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: With Katie's whereabouts still unknown, Kelly interrogates Vince - the man who threatened him during the blackout - but he's stopped in his tracks by Detective Lindsay, who tells him to let the professionals do their job. As hours turn into days and with still no sign of his sister, the firefighter decides to take matters into his own hands. Casey knows passing her medical check-up is essential if she's to continue with her training, so she lies about the doctor's diagnosis.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro's friend reports that his 14-year-old daughter is missing, and the detectives learn she is working as a prostitute - so they set up a sting operation to catch the pimp, and also arrest an ageing American football player. Starring Danny Pino and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape of an actress on stage during an interactive theatre production, only to discover the people in the audience - including her assailant - were all wearing masks. With no other leads, they are forced to track down an obsessive fan of the victim, who filmed the crime. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: John McTiernan's thriller stars Alec Baldwin as CIA officer Jack Ryan, who gets caught in a tense, volatile standoff between the US and renegade Russian submarine commander Marko Ramius. Ramius is in charge of Red October, a submarine far in advance of American technology and strike capability. But, on its maiden voyage, Ramius sets sail for American waters. Is he just testing the sub, or is he planning to unleash a nuclear strike, or setting out to defect? Ryan believes the Russian commander is defecting. But, with both the Americans and the Russians intent on destroying the vessel, does Ryan have enough time to save craft and crew from both sides?(n)

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: Academy Award nominee Harrison Ford stars as the wrongly convicted Dr. Richard Kimble, and Academy Award winner Tommy Lee Jones is U.S. Marshal Sam Gerard, his relentless pursuer, in this all-time classic intense thriller based on the hit television series of the 1960s, The Fugitive. Kimble had the perfect life - a beautiful wife, medical career, an expensive townhouse - a perfect life until the night his wife was murdered, died in his arms and he was convicted of the crime. On his way to the penitentiary, Kimble escapes. Now, like hunted prey, he keeps running, determined only to find his wife's murderer. Caught in a nightmare from which he cannot awaken, Dr. Richard Kimble is the fugitive(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thriller, the infamous San Andreas Fault gives way, producing a devastating earthquake across California. A highly skilled helicopter pilot (Dwayne Johnson) races to save his ex-wife (Carla Gugino) in Los Angeles before the complete destruction of the city. After one daring rescue, the pilot flies north toward San Francisco in search of his estranged daughter (Alexandra Daddario), racing against time and the inevitable aftershocks that promise to devastate the coastline(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas and tearing apart his letter to Santa, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul WS Anderson tunes-up Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" in this action flick about a contest pitting a convict against other convicts, with the winner walking off with his freedom(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: The Glimmer Man
programme.desc: Two LAPD detectives must set aside their differences when they're assigned to track down a serial killer the press has dubbed The Family Man(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Grand Visions is a short season of films driven by the vision and boldness of strong directors; passion projects made on a grand and uncompromising scale. The season kicks off with director Baz Luhrmann's western/ war adventure/ romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. It's soon obvious that she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: HMS Gannet's helicopter squadron rush to help when a man falls overboard into the icy waters of Loch Fyne, and the search is on for four missing teenagers in a dinghy in Windermere.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned, then follow the sale and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. After three months the team returns to review their progress.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers confront a man who has not paid the rent he owes to a single mother, and agent Lawrence is on the trail of the £30,000 owed by a financial advisor.(n)

programme.title: A Service of Hope Following the Westminster Terror Attack
programme.desc: In the presence of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Dan Walker presents live coverage from Westminster Abbey of a service of hope following the London terror attack two weeks ago.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Al reluctantly returns home for a memorial dedicated to his late father, where an old family friend gives him an insight into his dad's life, making him realise they have had more in common that he first thought.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts as neighbours Jane and Rosie from Newbury work together and answers questions to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a career-minded couple with a budget of £950,000 search for a home they could use for a holiday-let business in North Devon.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey, including a copper hopper funnel, a bedside table and an old mirror and washstand.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques in Longleat, Wiltshire, where experts Claire Rawle and Michael Baggott pick out a selection of interesting collectibles to be sold at auction, including an amethyst and pearl brooch and an autograph album featuring a set of Beatles' signatures - but their authenticity keeps the experts guessing. The presenter also uncovers the hidden architectural gems of one of Wiltshire's most famous sons, Christopher Wren, during a trip to London.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight more competitors enter the kitchen, challenged to create their own dish using ingredients taken from the MasterChef Market, including clams, kidneys and pork chops. The cooks must choose their ingredients wisely as three of them will be sent home after this initial round. For the second challenge, the remaining five are asked to create a two-course meal to impress judges John and Gregg, and also win over some of the competition's most inspiring winners and finalists from previous years.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Benefits Cap: Is It Working?.
programme.desc: Following the lives of families who have lost hundreds of pounds due to benefit caps. Tens of thousands of households claiming benefits have had their payments cut as part of a new government policy, and this programme follows parents as they struggle to provide for their families and keep their homes.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Dan Walker introduces highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Chelsea v Manchester City at Stamford Bridge and Hull City v Middlesbrough at the KCOM Stadium. Chelsea were looking to move another huge step closer to winning the title as they welcomed one of their nearest rivals, while the match between the Tigers and Boro was likely to be pivotal in the battle to avoid relegation.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: Paramedics race to help a young girl with breathing difficulties on the Isle of Man and every second counts for the Cornwall Air Ambulance rescuing an elderly man with an aneurysm.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters explore properties in Staffordshire, Essex and Monmouthshire, then speak to buyers including a first-time developer and a builder planning a new home for his fiancee.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers deal with squatters in central London - and things get physical when some refuse to leave. Lawrence and Kev try to find out if a garage has gone into liquidation.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the bogus car accessories flooding the UK market. Plus, the story of how a counterfeit insurance document led to disaster.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Thomas Plant and Christina Trevanion help two teams search for bargains at Staffordshire County Showground. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott oversees the day's proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha assumes the worst after learning Karl is wanted by the police, Karen does some digging on JJ, and Sid treats a dementia patient who does not have long left.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: A family of three try to work out the three-digit code to crack open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright asks the questions in the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple wanting to relocate to the Gloucestershire countryside with a budget of £550,000, and explores the extraordinary collection of an English eccentric.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues three items from the tip in Walsall, including a rusty lathe for Guy Trench to clean up, and an old toilet door, which Daniel Heath tries to work his magic on.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Will Axon and Philip Serrell visit Ickworth House, a Georgian mansion in Suffolk built for the Earls of Bristol, where the team picks out a selection of interesting items to be sold at auction. Will casts an appreciative eye over a piece of Martinware, but a miniature long case clock bought at the car boot for £1 could prove to be the star find. Plus, Paul heads to the Suffolk coast to explore a fantasy holiday village built in the early 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tina receives a helping hand from an unlikely friend, while Bex continues to reel from recent events. Lauren tells Max she intends to apply for a job at his company - and despite his advice to look elsewhere, she is determined to stick to her guns.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight more amateurs are given just 80 minutes to devise one dish using ingredients available in the MasterChef market. On offer today are duck legs, ox tail, lamb mince, langoustine, cod and scallops. The stakes are high as three hopefuls will be sent home, while the remaining five have to cook two courses to impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also two previous champions - Ping Coombes (2014) and Thomasina Miers (2005) - and 2006 finalist Dean Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team continue to explore the archipelago, much of which still remains a mystery to science. The presenter ventures far beneath the waves in a deep-sea submersible in search of an elusive ocean giant, the mola or sunfish, to understand more about its little-known behaviour. She also sees how sea lions have been affected by the El Nino weather phenomenon, before the team sails north for the most remote and inhospitable islands in the Galapagos - Wolf and Darwin, where Liz helps tag and track hammerhead sharks that school at this location.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Gillingham in Kent, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: The National Pet Service
programme.desc: A revealing look at the work of the People's Dispensary for Sick Animals, which has been helping those facing economic hardship to look after their pets for the past 100 years. Those struggling to afford private pet fees include boxing coach Tony, whose tough guy exterior belies his love for an overweight spaniel named Sophie, and retired hairdresser Angie, whose cat Leo helps her feel less alone in the world and has film star good looks.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul Martin and the show's experts offer advice on making money from vintage fashion.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officers meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Sheriff Lawrence discovers his claimant is not the only one owed money by a building company.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a skip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, including a dressing table and mirrors and an old rusty water tank.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates the arguments for and against BSL being taught more widely, and Memnos Costi tries out some of the latest smart phone apps making deaf lives easier.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Mary opens her garden to host a village fete and shares her flair for turning easy dishes into spectacular crowd-pleasers, and she is visited by two brothers for a lesson in the art of making authentic Italian pizzas.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Gemma and Chris Randle are keen to leave behind their hectic lifestyle in the West Midlands and sample life in Adelaide, Australia, for one week with their children to see if the move could offer them the family life they dream of. As presenter Nicki Chapman discovers, though the couple are impressed by the properties on offer, Gemma is not sure she can leave her parents behind in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Philip Serrell help a team of anglers and a team of golfers search for antiques at Wetherby Racecourse, West Yorkshire. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott takes a look around the Geffrye Museum in London's East End.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes Daniel O'Donnell back to the islands of Arranmore and Owey off the coast of Co Donegal, where the singer reminisces about a childhood holiday he had there in 1968.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Tamzin Outhwaite sets out to learn about her Italian roots on the maternal side of her family as a result of her fond childhood memories of big meals with relatives, antipasto and energetic conversations. Her journey begins in the heart of London's East End, where her great-grandfather Tony Gonella once ran a cafe. She visits the Isle of Man, Italy and finally Glasgow as she explores her ancestor's life, and also discovers more about her mother's father Remo Santi and his dad Adelmo.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Farm vet Richard carries out a tracheotomy to save a calf's life at Teesdale dairy farm, while in Fife, Megan investigates the cause of a guinea pig's cough and needs to remove a stick that is lodged inside a dog. Elsewhere, Steve is determined to help an abandoned elderly cat find a new home. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Kate Humble - Into the Volcano
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate joins a team of geologists on another research expedition in the southern Pacific as they head to the island of Ambrym in the Vanuatu archipelago. There she undertakes an arduous journey to the volcanic cone Marum - which contains one of only five lava lakes on the planet - abseiling right to its heart to discover if another major eruption may be imminent. Along the way she discovers how the volcano has shaped the customs and traditions of the islanders and discovers what it really means to live each day on its slopes.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals
programme.sub-title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates: From the Seas to the Skies.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist explores the evolution of vertebrates over the past 500 million years, beginning with a look at how remarkable advances allowed primitive fish to make the radical move on to land, and then take to the skies with the advent of flight. He uses fossils of both ancient and living species combined with CGI and film to chart their journey out of the water to populate all corners of the globe.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant travel through North Wales, starting in Ruthin, Denbighshire before heading to auction in Colwyn Bay, Conwy. Christina visits Caernarfon castle, while Thomas finds out about the only ever Welsh Prime Minister David Lloyd George.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team work together to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey westwards across the United States, discovering the hidden pleasures of 19th-century railroad workers in Sedalia and learning more about the birthplace of ragtime. He then travels to Paola, Kansas, where he auctions livestock and dines on spare ribs, before reaching his destination in St Joseph, Missouri.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: New series. Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in physical and mental challenges designed to test their ability to communicate, with trainers and canine scientists on hand to help them develop the relationship between human and animal. In the first episode, half the contestants must lead their dogs through a series of gates using verbal and physical signals, while the others must collect tennis balls in fast-flowing water. The final challenge sees the owners and dogs compete in a tethered biking challenge, to decide who has triumphed in the first stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: New series. Series following 10 strangers at turning points in their lives who are brought together to take over an Italian farm in the foothills of Mount Amiata, adjusting to the challenges of communal living in another country. In the first episode, they face the difficult tasks of bringing in a harvest of Merlot grapes and keeping the local wild boar at bay.(n)

programme.title: Jack Dee's Helpdesk
programme.desc: Jack Dee and guests Katherine Ryan, Larry Lamb, Jeremy Hardy and Andi Osho aim to help a studio audience to dispel their 'first world problems', and shed light on the dilemmas and issues relating to everyday lives.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents a look ahead to the first Major of the year, which will be held at the Augusta National in Georgia, and will see Danny Willett enter as reigning champion.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When he was 12 years old, Sharron Townsend was arrested for shooting a homeless man in the head. Now aged 14, he is facing justice. As this edition reveals, in Florida, children can be transferred to adult courts at the discretion of the State Attorney, so there is no upper limit on Sharron's sentence. Cameras also follow Jeremiah Hill, who shot a man during a gun trade when he was 13 years old. Now the justice system must decide how best to protect society.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Young ladies try to attract the King's attention at court, but behind the scenes, bloody business is being conducted and investigated. Meanwhile, Philippe's new-found fame as a warrior threatens to eclipse Louis' as the war reaches a turning point. The period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV continues. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates the arguments for and against BSL being taught more widely, and Memnos Costi tries out some of the latest smart phone apps making deaf lives easier.(n)

programme.title: The Red Nose African Convoy
programme.desc: Six celebrities set out on a 700km drive across East Africa to deliver crucial supplies that will help Comic Relief projects continue their life-saving health work. Working in pairs, David Baddiel, Hugh Dennis, Reggie Yates, Michaela Coel, Katy Brand and Russell Kane put their driving skills to the test as they brave the infamous Northern Corridor, considered to be one of the world's most dangerous roads to lead a convoy delivering vital supplies across East Africa. Along the way they visit a maternity unit where supplies are scarce, find out about projects to help those with HIV, deliver bicycles to health workers and distribute 3,000 life-saving mosquito nets.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Your Food
programme.desc: James Wong and Michael Mosley explore the way the brain can generate cravings to influence diets. James discovers the source of a food that invariably has a profound hold over the brain - fat-rich chocolate. Its primary ingredient is cocoa butter, which has a very characteristic effect on a set of receptors on the tongue. To understand these receptors, Michael examines a cream produced from the rich milk of water buffalo that has a similar effect. The duo also explore the hold that caffeinated drinks can have and take on some of the hottest chillies on the planet to show what the burn does to the brain. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offer advice on making money from travel related antiques and collectibles, while Paul Martin explores the history of the bicycle.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers confront a man who has not paid the rent he owes to a single mother, and agent Lawrence is on the trail of the £30,000 owed by a financial advisor.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey, including a copper hopper funnel, a bedside table and an old mirror and washstand.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden, when he plants bare root trees and gives advice on climbers that will happily grow on east-facing walls. Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone, while Frances Tophill meets the enthusiastic gardeners of Barbados who fill their gardens with colour, foliage and world class flowers. As part of the programmes 50th anniversary, Rachel de Thame reveals the plant she thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland: Dromod to Sligo.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Westminster in review
programme.desc: Keith Macdougall presents the highlights from Parliament since January including the terror attack on Parliament, the Brexit legislation, the U-Turn Budget, Labour lose a long-held seat at a by-election, the House of Lords stars in its own series, the collapse of the Northern Ireland Executive, the Scottish Government demands a new referendum on independence and the Speaker tells Donald Trump he's not welcome at Westminster.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The Strictly Come Dancing judge takes Homes Under the Hammer presenter Lucy Alexander back to Herne Bay in Kent to reminisce about a holiday she had in 1979.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Irish comedian Brendan O'Carroll, best known as his alter ego Mrs Brown and star of the BBC sitcom Mrs Brown's Boys, tries to find out the truth about his grandfather's murder, and attempts to uncover the identities of the men responsible. Shopkeeper Peter O'Carroll was killed in October 1920 at the height of the Irish War of Independence, and the Dublin-born actor begins his journey of discovery with only a newspaper article from the time and the words `shot during the curfew' from Peter's gravestone.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Equine vet Sybil has to contend with a Highland cow in Teesdale, Co Durham, while treating Fell ponies, and Steve judges a dog competition at the local Bowes Agricultural Show. Meanwhile, Angela has to break bad news to the owner of a Rottweiler at Fife's small animal hospital. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Examining how animals, including monkeys, wolves, bears, foxes and birds, cope with mountain life in the Himalayas, and how the harsh terrain has given many creatures remarkable strength. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals
programme.sub-title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates: Dawn of the Mammals.
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his exploration of the evolution of vertebrates over the past 500 million years by looking at the history of mammals. He traces their journey from humble origins as tiny nocturnal forest-dwellers to their astonishing explosion in diversity and domination of the world following the death of the dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant shop around Warwickshire and Essex, visiting a Battle of Britain airshow before heading for auction in Winchcombe, Gloucestershire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Guthred's lack of judgement has divided Northumbria, so Uhtred must travel North to defeat the brothers Erik and Sigefrid, take back Eoferwic and reassert the king's authority. Alfred sends Aethelwold to join the riding party, believing he can remind Guthred of his duty to Wessex - but Aethelwold's judgement becomes clouded. Meanwhile, a confrontation with the Northmen brings a shocking turn of events, and hostility is rife when Sven attempts to reason with Thyra.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Sara Pascoe and John Robins join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the events of October 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Sabine Schmitz compete in a buggy race across the Californian desert that is one of the toughest events in motorsport, and Matt LeBlanc test drives new supercar the Ford GT.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford travels to the Hague and Amsterdam to find out what inspired artists such as Rembrandt and Ruysch to create anatomical paintings in the 17th century, and learns how dissecting bodies became considered a suitable subject for art in the period.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the team's explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial.(n)

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Bernado explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Exposed: Magicians, Psychics and Frauds - Storyville.
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling magician James Randi's attempts to expose supposed faith healers, fortune-tellers and psychics who have borrowed tricks from magicians to swindle the masses. The programme examines his rivalry with spoon-bending illusionist Uri Geller, as well as how he exposed evangelist Peter Popoff's use of in-ear receivers in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: Servants: The True Story of Life Below Stairs
programme.desc: Historian Pamela Cox explores how Britain's domestic servants lived and worked in the 19th and 20th centuries, beginning by examining how the concept of service was perceived in Victorian society. She investigates the relationships between families and those they employed, discovers how power hierarchies developed, and learns why having domestic staff could pose problems for middle-class households.(n)

programme.title: Who Were the Greeks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Scott examines the influence of ancient Greece on the modern world, looking at its impact on democracy, art, architecture, philosophy, science, sport and theatre. He uses the latest archaeological, literary and scientific analysis to uncover the story of how the ideas of the period have spread, been misinterpreted and absorbed into the consciousness of human society.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: As Dan Snow's docudrama continues, King Harold has to take on two invasion forces. First, his brother Tostig attacks the south coast. He is repelled, but there is more to come. Later in the year, a vast Viking invasion force led by King Harald Hardrada of Norway lands in the north of England. Harold rushes to Stamford Bridge to fight for his kingdom and for his life.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Gothic: Britain's Midnight Hour
programme.sub-title: Blood for Sale: Gothic Goes Global.
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon concludes his examination of England's Gothic Revival, focusing on the emergence of a new gothic fantasy horror following the outbreak of the First World War. He considers how gothic language came to make sense of the modern world - from Karl Marx's description of `vampiric' capitalism, to author Joseph Conrad's dark vision of imperialism, and TS Eliot's critique of British society in his poem The Waste Land. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from July 14, featuring Paul Young, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, Heaven 17, Bananarama and Echo and the Bunnymen. Presented by Peter Powell and Andy Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: A Very British Map: The Ordnance Survey Story.
programme.desc: The history of a quintessentially British institution, which was formed in 1791, originally for military reasons before becoming a valuable tool in peacetime for ramblers and adventurers. Timeshift examines how the OS is adjusting to the digital age, with the large folding maps now just a small part of its output.(n)

programme.title: Mary Magdalene: Art's Scarlet Woman
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak explores how the image of Mary Magdalene has been invented and re-invented by artists from Caravaggio to Cezanne, Ruben to Rembrandt and Titian to Van Gogh.(n)

programme.title: Roof Racks and Hatchbacks: The Family Car
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the British experience of the family car, from the groundbreaking Morris Minor to the ubiquitous Ford Cortina, and the Range Rover to the new Jaguar F-Pace. The film looks at how designers have long endeavoured to make the family car attractive, even exciting, and to keep pace as the family and its requirements have evolved over the decades. Narrated by Grace Dent.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.desc: All Bets Are Off. Jules lashes out after listening to the ladies trash LuAnn. Meanwhile, Ramona tries to make amends with LuAnn; Sonja is set up on a blind date when she hosts an elegant dinner party; and the ladies hit the road for the Mohegan Sun casino(n)
