programme.title: Burn Notice
programme.desc: Michael is granted permission to visit Fiona, but before he arrives she needs to find out who is trying to kill her. She goes to the prison's black-market dealer to glean some information, but it doesn't come cheap. Meanwhile, Pearce receives a file from Anson Fullerton, containing the location of Ahmed Damour - the man who murdered her asset in 2003.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda's 40th birthday approaches, she investigates the high-profile case of a woman who was murdered at one of Los Angeles' trendiest restaurants. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The body of a woman is found in Provenza's garage, forcing Brenda to become involved in a cover-up of her own. The detective struggles to protect members of her team, who find themselves racing against the clock before the LAPD finds out what they are up to. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A magazine publisher is killed by a car bomb after he demands to meet a disabled girl he has been supporting. Goren and Eames begin to suspect the girl in question does not even exist and that her foster parents are running an elaborate fraud. Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A stockbroker discovers unsettling information about a company trading in land and water rights, and later becomes the prime suspect in the murder of her lover. However, evidence emerges that the crime is part of a scheme to manipulate share prices.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a paparazzo, who appears to have killed himself by jumping out of a hotel window. They discover a popular celebrity may have been the target of the photographer's prying camera. Meanwhile, calls from a female colleague to Fritz stir up feelings of jealousy in Brenda. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The dismembered body parts of an adult-film star are found in a skip, prompting Brenda and the team to look for more clues to solve the puzzle. However, once they begin gathering the evidence, the suspect list gets increasingly longer. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames' investigation into the murder of an undertaker leads them to discover a field of decomposed corpses. The detectives soon turn their attentions to the owner of a nearby crematorium and his shady relationship with a contract killer. Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A social services worker and a deputy mayor are murdered, and the detectives discover a link to a 10-year-old mathematics prodigy and his obsessive, pushy father. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio, with Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: 24: Legacy
programme.desc: As Mullins and CTU try and track down Carter, Andy is forced to do something that leaves him battling his own conscience. Meanwhile, Donovan questions Rebecca's judgment.(n)

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: The superhero thriller, starring Dan Stevens as troubled mutant David Haller, draws to a close with him facing his biggest challenge yet.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Halloween arrives, and Peter joins forces with Joe to play a series of painful pranks on his friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Brian teaches Stewie the basics of trick-or-treating, and Meg has high hopes for her first festively themed high-school party.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter receives tickets to a boxing match as a birthday gift, and ends up volunteering Lois to compete. To everyone's surprise, she proves to be a natural pugilist, prompting her hapless husband to become her fight promoter - little suspecting that she is using her marital frustrations as motivation in the ring.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan decides to alleviate the stresses of his hectic family life by buying a hot tub. However, he fails to count on his new purchase having an evil agenda of its own. Animated comedy, with the voice of show creator Seth MacFarlane, and guest star Cee-Lo Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Crossover episode in which characters from Family Guy and The Cleveland Show end up meeting the Smiths when a storm hits the towns of Quahog, Stoolbend and Langley Falls.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan saves Roger's life, but the pair disagree over the chain of events leading to the rescue, resulting in the alien attempting to make a fresh start. Meanwhile, Steve becomes power-hungry when he is given the job of making announcements over the school's PA system.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan tries to prove he is the alpha male at the Smith house when Steve challenges him for family dominance, while Hayley and Jeff seek marriage counselling after their honeymoon period wears off.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan begins playing golf with Senator Buckingham in a bid to advance in the CIA, but Roger accidentally sells the politician's daughter to a drug lord, which leaves Stan having to choose between his family and his career.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger bets Klaus that he can make Steve popular at school, but none of his plans seem to work - until the high school's in-crowd realise Steve can be their designated driver. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine play pranks on each other.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian learns Rush Limbaugh has arranged a book signing at the Quahog Mall, and decides to attend the event to give the outspoken radio talk-show host a piece of his mind. However, when Rush unexpectedly comes to his rescue, the liberal-thinking dog has a political change of heart.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers that Lois's dad Carter is having an affair and is forced to keep the dalliance a secret, but causes embarrassment by accidentally revealing the truth. In the aftermath, Lois's mother demands a divorce and Peter finds himself helping Carter adjust to life as a bachelor.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine gets a job at Stan's office, which leaves him unable to flirt with his co-workers - and to make matters even worse, jealousy leads to an awful encounter.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes Steve on a father-son bonding trip to the zoo, but it all goes horribly wrong when Steve slips into a gorilla exhibit. Meanwhile, Roger bets Hayley he can become a country singer, and tries to write the most heartbreaking song of all time. Animated comedy, created by Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Burn Notice
programme.desc: With the help of Sam and Jesse, Michael tries to find out who was pursuing Fiona, and discovers a jail guard shot dead at his house. Anson's right-hand-woman Rebecca is on the scene, and takes Sam hostage as she flees to the Everglades, forcing Michael and Jesse to chase after them without help from the police or CIA. While their colleague remains in peril, Fiona is faced with two deadly prison assassins.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team try to solve the case of a mother and daughter whose drowned bodies have been found by fishermen. As events proceed, a surprising revelation helps them unravel the mystery. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A boy blames himself for the death of his friend, forcing Brenda to tread lightly to get to the bottom of the case. To make matters worse, the deceased child's mother makes accusations of her own. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The murders of a university president and his assistant present the detectives with a number of suspects, including a controversial academic, a graduate student and an ambitious woman with her eye on the top job. Drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney takes the law into his own hands by gunning down a hired killer following a series of death threats. The finger of suspicion immediately points to his wife, but when cracks appear in the seemingly airtight case, Goren and Eames are led on a different trail. Spin-off drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and the gang interview potential friends to fill the vacancy left by Cleveland's departure, and Brian learns that Quagmire hates him - and only makes matters worse when he tries to find out why.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Nobody seems to care when Brian accidentally runs over and kills a fellow dog, so he tries to convince his friends that they should value canine lives as much as those of humans. Meanwhile, Lois hires a maid who does not listen to Peter.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The animated comedy following the exploits of CIA agent and `man's man' Stan Smith returns, as Stan relives the same Father's Day over and over again.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A misunderstanding at school leads to Steve receiving an F on a test, and Stan jumps to the conclusion that his previously nerdy son has gone off the rails.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Carter has a heart attack and lapses into a deep coma, so Peter takes over the running of his company Pewterschmidt Industries, but becomes power-mad and ends up firing every member of the board of directors.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter hits his head and develops total amnesia, leaving Lois facing the task of reacquainting him with his friends and family - not to mention such skills as driving and having sex.(n)

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: Yann Martel's ponderous adventure novel gets the big-screen treatment with this Fox 2000 adaptation helmed by director Ang Lee. The coming-of-age story surrounds the son of a zookeeper who survives a shipwreck by stowing away on a lifeboat with a zebra, an orangutan, a hyena, and a Bengal tiger by the name of Richard Parker. Suraj Sharma heads up the cast as the young boy, with Gérard Depardieu, Adil Hussain, Irrfan Khan, Rafe Spall, and Bollywood actress Tabu also starring(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller. In the late 21st century a factory worker looking for a break from his frustrating life visits a company that implants fake memories. programme.desc: There's a Puma in the Kitchen. Anne Elizabeth Ramsay makes one of her sporadic returns to Mad About You as Lisa, the still-unattached sister of Jamie Buchman (Helen Hunt). programme.title: Marvel's The Avengers
programme.desc: Marvel Studios delivers the ultimate comic-book film, which ties together such characters as Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.), Captain America (Chris Evans), The Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), and Thor (Chris Hemsworth) for a big-screen franchise team-up like no other. Taking center stage this time is Nick Fury (played once again by the note-perfect Samuel L. Jackson), leader of the peacekeeping agency known as S.H.I.E.L.D. Fury, along with former Russian spy Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson), recruits a super team to combat Thor's ever-deceptive brother Loki (Tom Hiddleston) after he brainwashes ace archer Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner) while stealing a cosmic cube from an underground base. Thus the heroes must learn to work together alongside outlaw scientist Bruce Banner (Ruffalo), who can track down the artifact's gamma signals when he's not hulking out into a giant green monster. Show runner Joss Whedon (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Firefly) adapted and helmed the script by Zak Penn(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Duffless. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) and his alcoholic friend Barney Gumble (also voiced by Castellaneta) sneak out of work and take a tour of the Duff Brewery, where they help themselves to the copious free samples of Duff Beer, Duff Lite, Duff Dry, Duff Dark, and Raspberry Duff. On his way home, Homer gets picked up for drunk driving, causing him to lose his license and to attend Alc-Anon meetings under a court order. He pledges to give up drinking for thirty days, in part to get his license back and in part to please Marge (voice of Julie Kavner), who is worried about Homer's fondness for alcohol. But Homer finds that going a month without beer is harder than he expected. Meanwhile, after Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) destroys a giant tomato that Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) was growing for a science fair project, she gets an idea for a new project -- an experiment in which she'll prove an ordinary hamster is smarter than her brother. Duffless was first aired on February 18, 1993(n)

programme.title: Archer

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wealthy and ambitious cattleman plans to seize all the land surrounding his own. A peaceful rancher living nearby ignores warnings to sell up and avoid a conflict, and as he suffers a campaign of intimidation, he is forced to adopt violent methods to defend his livelihood. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.(n)

programme.title: Bitter Victory
programme.desc: Two British officers are assigned to lead a raid on a German stronghold in Libya and steal secret documents. However, one of the pair suspects the other of having had an affair with his wife and the tension between them threatens the mission. Second World War drama, starring Richard Burton, Curt Jurgens, Ruth Roman and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: Retired lawman Wyatt Earp accepts the post of Tombstone city marshal when one of his brothers is killed by cattle rustlers, and embarks on a crusade to bring his murderers to justice and drive lawlessness from the streets. Western, directed by John Ford, starring Henry Fonda, Victor Mature, Linda Darnell and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along
programme.desc: A wannabe police officer persuades his girlfriend's tough detective brother to take him along on duty. The cop hopes to scare his unwanted partner away from his sister by exposing him to danger - but needs some help when the patrol leads to a run-in with the city's most wanted criminal. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Chicken
programme.desc: Premiere. Fifteen-year-old Richard has learning difficulties and lives a lonely, introverted life with his older brother Polly in a dilapidated caravan on a farm where they are squatting. When new owners take possession of the land, their presence brings excitement and hope for Richard, as he starts to develop a relationship with their 17-year-old daughter Annabel, but the new dynamic also provokes far darker consequences. Coming-of-age drama, starring Scott Chambers, Morgan Watkins and Yasmin Paige.(n)

programme.title: The Woman in Black
programme.desc: A lawyer tormented by the death of his wife is sent to a remote village to put deceased client Alice Drablow's affairs in order. The locals are suspicious of outsiders and determined to keep the area's tragic history a secret, and the late Mrs Drablow's isolated house appears to be haunted by a vengeful spirit that seems hell-bent on redressing a decades-past grievance. Horror based on Susan Hill's novel, with Daniel Radcliffe and Ciaran Hinds.(n)

programme.title: Mr X
programme.desc: Tessa Louise-Salome's documentary celebrates the work of the feted French auteur Leos Carax, who has released just five feature films between 1984 and 2012. She tracks his career through clips from his movies Boy Meets Girl, Mauvais Sang (aka The Night Is Young), Les Amants du Pont-Neuf, Pola X and Holy Motors, and there are interviews with the man himself, as well as collaborators and admirers including Juliette Binoche, Denis Lavant, Mireille Perrier, Eva Mendes and Kylie Minogue. In English, French and Japanese.(n)

programme.title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
programme.desc: An American schoolteacher volunteers to fight with a brigade of Republican soldiers during the Spanish Civil War, and is given the task of bombing a strategic bridge behind enemy lines. Oscar-winning drama based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, starring Gary Cooper, Ingrid Bergman and Katina Paxinou.(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: A US Marine unit fighting in the Pacific is ordered to capture Japanese troops so they can be interrogated for information about a new weapons base - but the mission proves even more difficult than expected. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.(n)

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: A clumsy 25-year-old would-be reporter is given the chance to prove herself when she is sent on an assignment to get an inside take on high-school life. However, when she falls for an English teacher, she has trouble maintaining the facade of a calm and sophisticated young lady, as all the bad memories of her awkward younger days come flooding back. Romantic comedy, with Drew Barrymore, Michael Vartan and David Arquette.(n)

programme.title: The Woman in Black: Angel of Death
programme.desc: Premiere. A group of evacuees and their teachers hope to find peace by escaping the nightly air raids on London at the remote Eel Marsh House. What they do not realise is that its malevolent ghost is still in residence and is out for blood. Horror sequel set during the Second World War, starring Helen McCrory, Jeremy Irvine and Phoebe Fox.(n)

programme.desc: A conman is caught in the act by the FBI, but a maverick agent offers him the chance to escape prison by assisting in a sting operation. The hustler finds himself involved in a scheme to bring down the corrupt, Mafia-affiliated politician, only to find his own ex-wife plotting revenge. Crime drama set in the 1970s, starring Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.desc: The team in Baltimore, Maryland, work on a crossword cake and bake a special United Services Organisation creation.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond girls, including maple oat nut scones, a cowgirl quiche, and champagne oranges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Over an evening walk, Ree Drummond plans some fast and healthy meals, including a houmous wrap, ginger steak salad, a grilled nectarine salad and a spicy cauliflower stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares four soups, starting with hamburger soup, before making tomato soup, one-pot wonder sausage, potato and kale soup, and spinach soup.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang introduces two surveyors to a variety of new flavours, taking them to London's Chinatown to browse the spice markets. She also demonstrates how to prepare red-cooked fish, crispy Mongolian lamb and Cantonese-style duck with pak choi and rice.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang takes two taxi drivers to London's Chinatown, where she demonstrates the wide variety of chilli-based products available on the market. She then teaches them how to cook tiger prawns with shiitake mushrooms and rice wine, and a Chinese take on fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes a breakfast burrito kit, pasta alla Ladd, chipotle ranch dressing for raw veggies, and cookies and cream cups for her daughters, who are going on a college tour.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her best friend are throwing a poolside girls' get-together. Hyacinth's hosting and Ree's taking on all the cookout favourites, but making them inside.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang meets two estate agents from Bridlington. East Yorkshire, taking them to visit London's Chinatown to search for the oriental store-cupboard staples groundnut oil and sesame oil. She then teaches them how to prepare Sichuan-style sweet-and-sour prawns and three-cup chicken, before challenging them to repeat her recipes.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two nurses visit London's Chinatown with Ching-He Huang to explore the wide variety of rice available on the market. Later, she teaches them to prepare a Taiwanese chicken and rice dish, along with ginger, chilli and soy-steamed cod with special egg-fried rice, before challenging them to reproduce the recipes she has demonstrated.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: Eight American bakers take part in the pre-heat challenge and create 'berry naked cakes'.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers come up with a fat-friendly pie for fellow dieter Ann, baking a pastry treat that comes in below the 700 calories of a standard pork pie - but keen to lose as much weight as they can, they don't taste it themselves. Moving on to Dave's home town of Barrow-in-Furness in Cumbria, the duo try to persuade the diners in Chinese and Indian restaurants that their favourite dishes can be even better with all the fattening elements removed.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a craft-cooking family restaurant in Portland where he joins a chef who butchers, cures, preserves and smokes everything in-house.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri stops by a re-purposed garage in the Mission District of San Fransisco for some braised beef short ribs and spicy shrimp with gravy.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Atlanta, Georgia, where he tries to finish a 13lb `carnivore' pizza - but the challenge is too great and he has to recruit help.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Boston and is faced with the task of eating the Eagle's Challenge burger.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Owner of The Pepper Jack Grill in Staten Island asks for help in her business, she treats her staff like family but this is soon becoming dysfunctional.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours that kegs of his privately brewed beer are showing up at local parties, Rick, owner of Uncle Billy's Brew and Que in Austin, Texas, contacts Charles for help.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Beets Cafe, Austin, Texas, asks the team for help when she fears that her employees are selling the secret recipes to her raw food menu.(n)

programme.desc: Boycie puts Marlene under pressure to fit in with the locals, so she decides to take up cookery - an idea that does not go down well with her family. programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria decides that she should do something worthwhile with her life and goes for a job. However, husband Ben is not supportive. Wendy Craig stars.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: A local widow attracts father's attentions, and with mother's constant harping about her intentions, Timothy bears the brunt of her wrath and worry. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett, Barbara Lott and William Moore.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel finally reaches the end of his tether with busybody secretary Mrs Flack - so Jean hatches a cunning plan to ease her out without causing a scene. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer and Vivienne Martin.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic sitcom, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz is forced to take radical action to ensure the boys do not come out of the bridge job penniless, but it seems unlikely that his unique brand of sexual charm will save the day - and his doubts about son Rod's masculinity do not do much to help his focus. Just as they seem doomed to fail, a mysterious stranger arrives. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's comedy drama, with Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard and Marina go bird watching, while Foggy comes up with a way to make hiking up hills more exciting.(n)

programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Duke's country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Henry IX
programme.desc: New series. Comedy starring Charles Edwards as a king who has a crisis of confidence and tries to modernise the monarchy - despite the objections of his family. With Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Roman's facial gets out of hand when estranged wife Bubbles interferes, and Dudley is shocked by Ting Tong's latest revelations, but cannot resist her tight green outfit. Orville is harassed in a supermarket and Marjorie Dawes gets star-struck when a celebrity addition to Fat Fighters arrives. Featuring guest appearances by Rob Brydon and former EastEnder Derek Martin (Charlie Slater).(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark grows concerned that Jeff and Sophie's work trip to Aberdeen could turn into something intimate, and attempts to stop them hooking up together. Meanwhile, Jeremy gets a new girlfriend - but is seized by fits of jealousy whenever she looks at another man. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: The comedy duo pay tongue-in-cheek tribute to Fleetwood Mac, discuss Jerry Hall and star in a parody of In Bed with Madonna.(n)

programme.desc: Lee and Tim are excited to discover a lesbian couple living in their building and invite them over to dinner. However, the immature friends are unprepared for the effect one of the women has on Lucy. Sitcom, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Tim Vine.(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: Phil Mickelson - Masters and Ryder Cup
programme.desc: Phil Mickelson - Masters and Ryder Cup. Part 1 of 2. David Feherty sits down with Hall of Famer Phil Mickelson. Topics include Phil's three Masters victories, his rivalry with Tiger Woods, competing in 11 straight Ryder Cups, trash-talking, and his wife Amy's battle with breast cancer(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: Phil Mickelson - Hall of Fame Career
programme.desc: Phil Mickelson - Hall of Fame Career. Conclusion. A chat with Phil Mickelson to discuss his Hall of Fame career. Topics include Phil's pursuit of the career grand slam, his victories in the 2013 Open and the 2005 PGA Championship, as well as his relationship with caddie Jim "Bones" McKay and his commitment to his three children(n)

programme.title: Tin Cup
programme.desc: Golfing drama about a washed-up old pro who tries to get back into the big time. Roy 'Tin Cup' McAvoy (Kevin Costner) ruined his career when he took a risk on the golf course which led to his disqualification from the game. Now he teaches golf to others at a driving range in Salome, Texas, with the help of his trusted friend Romeo Posar (Cheech Marin). But McAvoy's life starts to change when a new student walks into the training centre - Dr Molly Griswold (Rene Russo), who just happens to be dating PGA star David Simms (Don Johnson). To win Molly, 'Tin Cup' knows that he must impress her - and what better way than by beating Simms and winning the US Open? The problem, of course, is that 'Tin Cup' has been teaching golf for so long that he may have forgotten how to play!(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: The Hogtown Cure, Son of a Peach, Belle Isle Seafood.
programme.desc: John Catucci learns why Toronto earns its nickname at the Hogtown Cure, and in Burlington, Ontario, enjoys a few home comforts at pizza-burger joint Son of a Peach.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The next two semi-finalists work a shift at the Michelin-starred Latymer restaurant in the Pennyhill Park Hotel in Bagshot, Surrey. The pair must recreate head chef Michael Wignall's signature dish of quail breast with confit quail leg, braised tongue, sweetbreads and cockscomb in a port glaze. They then draw on what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Gregg Wallace, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the links between American and British culinary cultures. They make clam chowder and chocolate brownies, before visiting London's Savoy hotel to discuss the history of the cocktail and reveal how the farmers' market is one of the UK's favourite imports from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker explores the diverse and colourful world of flatbreads, making corn tortillas served stacked and layered with spicy roast chicken, guacamole and sour cream. Paul also bakes a Middle Eastern maneesh to dip in a smoky baba ganoush, tries his hand at making traditional wafer-thin Indian lentil dosas and gets to grips with a supersize Caribbean roti known as `buss up shot'. He shares his love of Cypriot food with a recipe for nigella-scented pittas stuffed with pork souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: Chef James Martin's culinary journey to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues with an exploration of the country's passion for cupcakes and a sample of the state dessert of Maryland.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The next two semi-finalists work a shift at the Michelin-starred Latymer restaurant in the Pennyhill Park Hotel in Bagshot, Surrey. The pair must recreate head chef Michael Wignall's signature dish of quail breast with confit quail leg, braised tongue, sweetbreads and cockscomb in a port glaze. They then draw on what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Gregg Wallace, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the links between American and British culinary cultures. They make clam chowder and chocolate brownies, before visiting London's Savoy hotel to discuss the history of the cocktail and reveal how the farmers' market is one of the UK's favourite imports from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker explores the diverse and colourful world of flatbreads, making corn tortillas served stacked and layered with spicy roast chicken, guacamole and sour cream. Paul also bakes a Middle Eastern maneesh to dip in a smoky baba ganoush, tries his hand at making traditional wafer-thin Indian lentil dosas and gets to grips with a supersize Caribbean roti known as `buss up shot'. He shares his love of Cypriot food with a recipe for nigella-scented pittas stuffed with pork souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Rome Edition with Tonda, Flavio al Velavevodetto, La Gatta Mangiona.
programme.desc: John Catucci leaves Canada to sample comfort food from Italy, in the first of two special editions. This time, he visits Rome, and samples the menus at three must-eat restaurants.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Florence Edition with All'Antico Vinaio, Trattoria 4 Leoni, Trattoria Mario.
programme.desc: John Catuccis's Italian double bill continues as he heads to Florence, where he samples All'Antico Vinaio's in-demand panini, and Tuscan truffles at Trattoria 4 Leoni.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The competitors reach the penultimate round of the contest, heading to the Cornish village of Mousehole to test their pastry-making skills. They are challenged to produce their own versions of hearty British classics, while Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins examine the history of pies, detailing their slightly more sinister past.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The last two semi-finalists work a shift under chef Sat Bains at his two Michelin-starred restaurant in Nottingham, before recreating one of the establishment's signature dishes of pickled and sauteed mushrooms and braised oxtail with watercress panna cotta and chive beurre noisette. They then face a third test in which they must use what they have learnt from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reflect on the 1960s, a decade of music, fashion and food trends that are still around today. They prepare steak Diane and profiteroles, meet a restaurateur who made eating out trendy and look back on a time when the motorway cafe was the height of sophisticated dining for some.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker reveals the secrets to making classic European varieties of bread. Paul starts with France by demonstrating how to make a baguette that fits into a home oven and then transforms it into roasted garlic bread. He then explores Italian cuisine, baking a crusty ciabatta for a panzanella salad and crunchy biscotti snacks, before showing how to toss the perfect pizza base without it sticking to the ceiling.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: The chef's culinary journey to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues in Baltimore, where he samples a Pimlico cake, before tasting a variety made for only six weeks of the year in rural Maryland.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: Unguarded
programme.desc: A production of ESPN Films, this sports documentary from director Jonathan Hock profiles Chris Herren, an athlete with a spectacular rise and a tragic fall. A native of Fall River, Massachusetts, Herren performed so remarkably as a high school varsity basketball player that he attained legendary status even before he graduated from 12th grade. His success continued through his undergraduate enrollment at Fresno State, and ultimately enabled him to make the cut for the Boston Celtics, but at about the same time, Herren developed a serious drug addiction that cost him his place in the pros and literally almost killed him. Though he survived, just barely, his story continues to sound a cautionary note to others who may find themselves in similar positions(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!

programme.title: Abortion: Stories Women Tell
programme.desc: Director Tracy Droz Tragos examines the debate over abortion rights in her home state of Missouri by telling the personal stories of numerous womens' experiences in this documentary. Missouri has become a state with some of the most restrictive abortion legislation, with laws requiring mandatory counseling and waiting periods before access to the procedure(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. This bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters..(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: One Missed Call
programme.desc: Shannyn Sossamon and Ed Burns star in director Eric Valette's remake of Takashi Miike's frightful tale about a cell-phone call from the future that foreshadows one's own death. Beth Raymond (Sossamon) is a college student whose friends have all been dying in droves, and the one connecting factor between all of the incidents is that just before their deaths, each of the victims received a message in which they heard themselves being murdered. Upon receiving her own frightening phone call, Beth has only three days to solve the mystery and cheat death. Burns co-stars as a detective who is deeply troubled by the recent spate of deaths(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course
programme.desc: Scrat's epic pursuit of the elusive acorn catapults him into the universe where he accidentally sets off a series of cosmic events that transform and threaten the Ice Age World(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Patrick Warburton and Julie Bowen star in John Pasquin's comedy-drama about a man whose life is changed by a bullying incident. Mild-mannered Joe Scheffer is taking his pre-teen daughter Natalie to a corporate event at his big pharma workplace when an argument over a parking space results in Joe being set upon by a colleague Mark McKinney. The incident destroys Joe's confidence and he sinks into a depression that keeps him away from work. But his life is set to change when the company's 'wellness co-ordinator', Meg Harper, pays him a visit. There's immediate mutual attraction, but something she says to Joe also inadvertently sparks a desire for revenge in him. It's not long before he's training with Chuck Scarett, a former martial arts film star; and - back at work - his new, assertive persona is winning him legions of friends. But not everyone is impressed - Natalie and Meg preferred him as he was..(n)

programme.title: 2 Days: Vasyl Lomachenko
programme.desc: A 48-hour visit with junior-lightweight boxer Vasyl Lomachenko(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Exhilarating biopic of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens (Stephan James) and his inspiring journey to overcome racism at home and abroad, culminating in his triumphant track and field performance at the 1936 Berlin Olympics under the tutelage of gruff Ohio State coach Larry Snyder (Jason Sudeikis) and the skeptical gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, a bumbling private eye and an enforcer-for-hire team up to find a missing woman with ties to the porn industry. In time, their sleuthing reveals a far-reaching conspiracy involving corruption in the federal government(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: In a side-splitting film that brings together some of comedy's sharpest talent, 30 Rock star Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and writer/director Michael McCullers join forces to tell the story of two women, one apartment and the nine months that will change their lives. The always winning and wry Fey portrays a focused and driven New York career woman who desperately wants a baby but is physically unable to carry the child herself. Undaunted, she recruits a South Philly working girl (Poehler) to act as her surrogate. Everything goes according to plan until a pregnant Poehler shows up on Fey's doorstep with no place to live, and suddenly two very different women are joined together to create a very unexpected family(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus(n)

Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. programme.desc: Damon Wayans and Adam Sandler star in Bulletproof an action comedy from Universal Pictures. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Sisters'

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy-drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing.The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

Sent back in time, the 'toys' are trying to pass on a message about the future. And the more Noah and Emma play with the objects from the box, the more their intelligence grows. programme.desc: The world's most enigmatic superhero, Batman, resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure. This time, he's pitted against villainous freak The Penguin and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman , both of whom are out for revenge against the world which has treated them so cruelly and which Batman seems to represent. These new foes prove more than a match for him both on a professional and a personal level, especially when The Penguin enlists the help of industrialist Max Shreck to run for mayor of Gotham, and when Catwoman takes a sadomasochistic shine to her rubber-suited nemesis(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama. Five total strangers - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - are brought together on a day-long detention where they break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school. One of the plethora of 80s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: One woman's rocky road to the altar gets played for laughs in this comedy, adapted from the one-woman off-Broadway show written by and starring Nia Vardalos. Toula (Vardalos) is a Greek-American woman who is in her early thirties and single, with no immediate prospects of changing that status any time soon. This bothers Toula a bit, but not half as much as it distresses her mother (Lainie Kazan) and father (Michael Constantine), who want to send her to Greece in hopes of finding a husband in the old country. Toula isn't interested in leaving the country to find a man, but since she works in the family business -- a Greek restaurant in Chicago called Dancing Zorba's -- she has to hear about it whether she likes it or not. One day, after seeing a handsome stranger in the restaurant and not having the courage to talk to him, Toula decides she needs a bit of self-improvement. Despite her dad's misgivings, Toula signs up for a night-school class studying computers, trades in her glasses for contact lenses, gets a different job at a travel agency, and spruces herself up with a new look and a new attitude. To her very pleasant surprise, she once again encounters the handsome stranger, who soon asks her out on a date. Schoolteacher Ian Miller (John Corbett) is seemingly perfect -- he's tall, handsome, smart, good-natured, and soon in love with Toula -- except for two little things: he's not Greek, and he's a vegetarian, both of which horrify Toula's family. When Ian pops the question (and Toula says yes), the bride-to-be has to negotiate a reasonably peaceful meeting between Ian's upper-class parents and her own working-class extended family. There's also the matter of the wedding, which Toula's mother is planning around the notion that quantity IS quality. My Big Fat Greek Wedding also features Ian Gomez (Vardalos' real-life husband), Louis Mandylor, Andrea Martin, and Joey Fatone (from the pop group *NSYNC). Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson helped produce the film through the auspices of their production company, Playtone(n)

programme.title: Questioning Darwin
programme.desc: A look at creationist theory includes an examination of naturalist Charles Darwin's findings and theory of natural selection, and how they affected his religious views in the 19th century(n)

programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: A true story. It is January 1, 1923 in Rosewood, but in this largely black town built on family, faith and hard work, hopes for the New Year abruptly end. In a few harrowing nights, a white mob razes Rosewood into oblivion. As the rampage gains cataclysmic force, a heroic World War I veteran and a shopkeeper join forces. Dozens of terrified women and children have fled into nearby swamps. Somehow they must be led to safety(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Barry Levinson directed this crime drama based on a controversial bestseller. Jason Patrick stars as Lorenzo, a New York reporter more commonly called "Shakes," a nickname courtesy of his three childhood pals from Hell's Kitchen -- Michael (Brad Pitt), John (Ron Eldard), and Tommy (Billy Crudup). As kids, all four were sent to reform school after accidentally killing someone during a cruel prank. There, the boys were raped and beaten by several guards, including Sean Nokes (Kevin Bacon), a fact that they've kept secret into adulthood. Michael is now a rising star in the district attorney's office, while John and Tommy are founders of the Irish gang the Westies. When Nokes walks into John and Tommy's hangout, they kill him in cold blood and go on trial, defended by a drug-addicted lawyer (Dustin Hoffman). Michael and Shakes conspire with childhood friend Carol (Minnie Driver) and local priest Father Bobby (Robert DeNiro) to free their friends and get even with the surviving guards. Based on a true story chronicled by Lorenzo Carcaterra in his novel of the same name, Sleepers stirred controversy when the veracity of the book was challenged by reporters who could find no documentation of the events described(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Employee of the Month
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Employee of the Month. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

Billy Costigan is a police officer assigned to work undercover with Irish mobster Frank Costello to get evidences to arrest him. On the other side, Colin Sullivan, the informer of Costello, is promoted in the Massachusetts State Police. The Departed also received the Best Picture Academy Award(n)

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: Your mind is the scene of the crime. Box-office superstar Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this contemporary science fiction action film set within the architecture of the mind. Written, directed and produced by Oscar® and Golden Globe nominee Christopher Nolan (The Dark Knight, Batman Begins, The Prestige), this eagerly awaited follow-up to 2008's billion-dollar blockbuster is yet another visionary tale from a startingly original filmmaker who continually raises the bar with every film he makes. Shooting in London, Paris, Tangiers, Calgary and Los Angeles, Nolan's mind-bending film also stars Academy Award® winners Michael Caine and Marion Cotillard, in addition to Juno's Ellen Page, Batman Begins' Cillian Murphy and Oscar® nominees Ken Watanabe (The Last Samurai) and Tom Berenger (Platoon)(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: After being nominated seven times to the Oscars, Martin Scorsese won the Best Director statuette for this crime thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson and Mark Wahlberg, among other stars. Billy Costigan is a police officer assigned to work undercover with Irish mobster Frank Costello to get evidences to arrest him. On the other side, Colin Sullivan, the informer of Costello, is promoted in the Massachusetts State Police. The Departed also received the Best Picture Academy Award(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. When Tiger and Joey hear about the free trip they decide that they want to get involved too, but end up being roped into being the entertainment for the park's visitors, with disastrous results.(n)

programme.title: Crash: Anatomy of an Accident
programme.desc: On the morning of September 5, 2013, 130 vehicles on the Sheppey Crossing in Kent collided in thick fog. In the chaos that followed, more than 300 people found themselves trapped amidst a sea of crumpled and twisted metal and broken glass. This drama-documentary focuses on the personal stories of some of the people caught up in one of the biggest pile-ups seen on British roads.(n)

programme.desc: As Britain gets ready for Brexit, one of the key questions is what the country trades and who with. Get it right and it could herald a new age of prosperity. Get it wrong and everyone could end up poorer. Julie Etchingham explores the opportunities and obstacles as Britain prepares to leave a trading block it has called home for almost half a century. Postponed from March 23.(n)

programme.desc: Aaron is overwhelmed to discover his friends have arranged a surprise party to celebrate his release from prison - but Robert has cause for concern when Rebecca makes an appearance. Their job is to help Harry fill a capsule with funny clips, songs, sketches and games to prove that Earth doesn't deserve to be invaded by extraterrestrials.(n)

programme.desc: The police officers are numb after the explosion, and as they search the rubble, they make a horrifying realisation. The Bentleys make one last stand as a manhunt is launched for Clifford and David, while a distraught Renee is put under arrest. Before long Tennison makes one final discovery about Julie Ann's murder - but as she gets closer to solving the case, she finds herself in mortal danger. Stefanie Martini stars as the novice WPC who would eventually become the tough senior detective made famous by Helen Mirren. Last in the series.(n)

Meanwhile, the Aidensfield police officers are baffled by the activities of a modern-day Robin Hood, who has committed a string of burglaries and given away his ill-gotten gains to the elderly residents of a new block of flats. Drama, starring Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady).(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A local gigolo is murdered, forcing Jack to face the uncomfortable fact that some women are willing to pay for sex - and triggering an investigation that takes him into the seedy world of male escorts and their clientele. David Jason stars as the old-fashioned copper, with Isla Blair, Russell Hunter, Joanna David and Martin Jarvis.(n)

programme.title: Cold Blood
programme.desc: Series based on two previous one-off thrillers. A man with learning difficulties has his murder conviction overturned, forcing DS Eve Granger to reopen the case. Jailed serial killer Brian Wicklow offers to help with the investigation - and makes her realise she may have been allowing misplaced compassion to cloud her judgement. Matthew Kelly guest stars once more as Wicklow, with Jemma Redgrave, John Hannah and Pauline Quirke.(n)

programme.title: Doctor at Large
programme.desc: Michael takes over from an overworked Paul in the hospital's casualty department, and finds himself up on a negligence charge. Medical comedy, starring Barry Evans.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital staff are pushed to their limits when an amusement arcade collapses. In the search for survivors, a child is found with a suspected blood-clotting disorder and the team must find his mother to obtain his medical history. Stella enters the wreckage to free a girl who is trapped under a fruit machine, but when she becomes blocked in, Frankie tries to save her - and declares his feelings in the process. Medical drama, starring Natalie Anderson and Scott Taylor.(n)

programme.desc: As the staff come to terms with the recent tragic events, new ambulance driver Bobby makes a dramatic entrance. programme.desc: Local boy Barry Dyson is accused of a series of arson attacks - and his clandestine relationship with a former employer's daughter complicates his plea of innocence. programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love.
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James is found alive but seriously injured in a French hospital, much to Sir Richard's relief. Gordon Jackson stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Sunny makes further investigations into David Walker's life that suggest he was a troubled man with a number of issues. Marion has a prickly chat with Cassie about her past and the inquiry reveals her close relationship with an IRA activist. As the police investigation encroaches on their life, Sara and Colin open up to their partners with secrets about their past. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Wendy Craig and Holly Aird.(n)

programme.title: Paranoid
programme.desc: Alec is rescued from the water and rushed to hospital, where he receives an unexpected visitor. In Dusseldorf, Linda's suspicions seem justified when she has a breakthrough and starts to believe Ruben Locana's death was not an accident. Back in the UK, Bobby, Nina and Alec face a race against time as they try to locate the pages at the heart of the case. Conspiracy thriller, starring Robert Glenister, Indira Varma, Dino Fetscher and Christiane Paul, with Lesley Sharp, Neil Stuke, John Duttine and Anji Monhindra.(n)

programme.title: Harlots
programme.desc: When an old friend arrives in town, Margaret's hopes for the Soho move rest on whether she can tempt him to invest, while Justice Cunliffe makes Lydia an intriguing offer and Emily adjusts to the constraints of life in the Quigley household.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Japp and Poirot investigate the murder of an actress's estranged husband, only to find in the theatrical world, where deception and play-acting are a way of life, nothing is quite what it seems. In time-honoured fashion, it initially looks as though the butler did it - but subsequent inquiries throw up a veritable rogues' gallery of equally likely suspects. Philip Jackson, David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: Part two of two. The truth about Leonard Vance's fate is revealed as the crime drama draws to a close. Sean realises missing lawyer and single father Stephen Eli does not fit the pattern of the other disappearances. He believes Eli is a victim of imprisoned serial killer Vance, who eventually confesses to the crime. But when Vance can't guide police to Eli's body, Sean begins to wonder if he's made a mistake, and that somebody else is responsible for not only Eli's death, but also the other murders supposedly committed by Vance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Robert has no wish to find the monster that is killing wealthy young men, but the trail is too compelling to resist. It leads him to a fight with a beautiful vampire who shocks him with the news that she's his sister, Olalla. She also tells him Dance is alive and being rebuilt by eel creatures. Robert is suspicious of a trap and sets a test - if she can turn into a Jekyll he'll believe her. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Bateman and Wallis Day.(n)

programme.desc: When the Mayor retires, Lucia is invited to stand for election on the Tilling council - giving her a taste for power. Prunella Scales stars.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Exasperated at the Sheriff's record in office, King John visits Sherwood to personally oversee the destruction of Robin and his outlaw band - a task he entrusts to the ruthless Roger de Carnac. Phil Davis and Matt Frewer guest star.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.sub-title: Map of the Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: Conclusion of a tense two-part story. As Cardale struggles to come to terms with David's shocking death, a destructive patient pushes Andrew's patience to the limit. Long-running medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick has to go undercover following the unlikely event of a gangster setting up shop in rural Aidensfield - and luckily his former girlfriend Jill is able to help out.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of a moody whodunit from the pen of Britain's queen of crime fiction, starring Eleanor David as bride-to-be Alice Whittaker, whose marriage plans are thrown into turmoil by the disappearance of a close friend opposed to her impending nuptials. Disregarding assurances that there is nothing to worry about, Alice sets out to investigate - and soon uncovers evidence of foul play lurking just beneath the surface of local life. With Mark Frankel, Peter Egan, Jane Gurnett and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: A distraught mother asks Sir Richard to intervene on behalf of her son, who has been charged with cowardice, while the Bellamy household is disrupted by news of Edward going Awol and threats from the military police.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates a double poisoning, aiming to prove the innocence of Elinor Carlisle, the chief suspect in the deaths of her aunt and her rival in love. However, it emerges that she is the only person with a motive, opportunity and means to administer the poison. Crime drama, starring David Suchet, Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Diana Quick, Paul McGann and Rupert Penry-Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: In Whitehall, the king is angry to learn his orders to create firebreaks have been ignored by his advisers, while Sarah, still separated from Thomas, sneaks back into Hanford's house and retrieves the mysterious box from Romero's room. Later, Lord Denton reads the letters inside and realises that James, Duke of York, is the mastermind behind the plot to assassinate his brother Charles. Elizabeth confronts Pepys about his infidelity and decides to get even as she pays her dance teacher Alfredo a visit.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: When Hannah lets slip to David that his father is alive, he runs off to the Navy yards to seek the truth, closely followed by her. As Thomas and Sarah search for the children, Sarah is captured and dragged away, finding herself accused of treason. With Lord Denton doing everything in his power to convince the king of her involvement in the plot to start the fire, her only hope lies with her brother-in-law - can the baker get in touch with Samuel before it's too late? Andrew Buchan, Rose Leslie and Charles Dance star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Halcyon
programme.desc: Lady Hamilton wants Freddie to use his leave from the RAF to support her with the hotel and it becomes clear she wants to make changed and that Garland is in her sights. The hotel manager insists he's not worried and that he just needs to show how indispensable he is, but Peggy and Feldman aren't so sure, while Charity meets Joe and reveals her plans for revenge, but he refuses to help her, and Emma and Betsey hit the town. Drama, starring Olivia Williams, Steven Mackintosh, Jamie Blackley and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Complaints about a mistreated boxer dog lead investigators to a repeat animal abuser, and the officers decide to press charges.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Officers catch three boys training a pit bull to fight by using a puppy as bait, and further investigation leads to more evidence of animal abuse.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Bethany Decker, a National Guardsman's wife, who vanished while pregnant with her second child as her husband completed a tour of service in Afghanistan. Police discovered the 21-year-old's life was far more complicated than anyone realised.(n)

programme.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: The legal battle that followed the 1993 death of country music singer Conway Twitty, who left an estate valued at $15million.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The presenter revisits the case of Detroit brothers Tommy and Ray Highers, who it is claimed, spent 25 years behind bars for a murder they did not commit.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of David Pauley, who secured a ranch worker job he had seen advertised on Craigslist, before disappearing shortly afterwards.(n)
