programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How clues found in common substances can help investigators solve homicide cases.(n)

programme.desc: A case from 2008, when the discovery of the bullet-riddled bodies of 11-year-old Skyla Whitaker and 13-year-old Taylor Placker sent the Oklahoma community of Weleetka into a state of panic.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.(n)

Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.(n)

programme.desc: A case in which a young woman's body was found in a ditch in Minnesota. Investigators embarked on a decades-long hunt to identify her and inform her family.(n)

programme.desc: The case of 69-year-old Loretta Bowersock, who in December 2004 disappeared while shopping. She was discovered in a shallow grave two years later, as a long-time boyfriend came under suspicion.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigating the case of a mother and daughter who went missing following a fire on their boat. A forensic analysis of the wreckage suggested the blaze was started deliberately.(n)

programme.desc: The investigators' attentions are drawn to a woman whose house is full of neglected animals. An examination suggests some of the creatures will not survive.(n)

programme.desc: Rescue driver Andre Folks is confronted by four angry pit bulls while trying to execute a night-time drugs raid.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Northumberland to restore a real `barn find'; a 1934 Morgan F4 three-wheeler, which has been stored in a shed for more than 50 years. The vehicle was one of the most successful lightweight cars from the early days of motoring.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cosmetic surgery fan Shanice hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, Surrey, where risky menu choices and a fellow diner's laugh become talking points.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford, and hopes to win with a Norwegian feast, as tensions rise between Shanice and Charlotte.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. However, his unusual fayre is tempered by his choice of yodelling entertainment, which threatens to hinder his chance of scooping the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Deborah Sims has long dreamt of relocating permanently to southern Spain. With a budget of £90,000, she is looking for a property in the Manilva region, with an easy commute to Gibraltar. It's a big lifestyle change to make on her own, so it's important that presenter Sara Demergi finds the ideal property that can help start the next chapter of Deborah's life.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Shropshire publicans Chris and Sue, who have wanted a holiday home abroad for 10 years, go in search of their dream property on Portugal's Silver Coast.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Fetlar, Shetland Islands: The Giant's Grave.
programme.desc: The experts go in search of clues to the contents of an enigmatic cliff-top mound on Fetlar in the Shetlands known as the Giant's Grave. Battling the weather, they set out to discover whether it is connected to pieces of Viking pottery found in a nearby garden and unearth rare and extraordinary finds in three days.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts visit the Naval College and Maritime Museum in Greenwich, which stands on the site of Henry VIII's favourite palace. They have just three days to locate the missing jousting yard, where the king indulged his love of the sport, and the armoury - offering Phil Harding the chance to model some authentic protective equipment of the time.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit petrol-head Kim in Hampshire, the owner of an accident-damaged 1995 Nissan Skyline GT-R. The team take on the challenge of transforming her Japanese supercar into a street racer's dream.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The odds are stacked against Noel Fitzpatrick and his team as a golden retriever puppy with horrific facial injuries is brought into the practice after being attacked by another dog. Plus, a man drives all the way from Switzerland in the hope of a successful treatment for a Chihuahua, and a woman brings in her Hungarian vizsla, which has a bone and cartilage disorder.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescued bulldog Dolly is having trouble with all four legs, police dog Anya's spine has been badly damaged, and a retired greyhound called Lola has a mystery problem. `Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick does what he can to help them at the pioneering veterinary practice.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Thomas and Dervla O'Hare, an ambitious couple who set out to construct a spectacular split-level home cascading down an almost vertical Belfast hillside. The plan was to complete the build quickly, but because they lacked any prior experience, managing the complicated project proved a real challenge.(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: An uneducated teenager from the Mumbai slums is only one question away from winning a quiz show, but the authorities are reluctant to believe a youngster from such a humble background could succeed without cheating. Under questioning, he tells a police inspector the eventful story of his life - and how he came to know so much. Danny Boyle's Oscar-winning drama, starring Dev Patel and Freida Pinto.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts another round of light-hearted words-and-numbers fun, with Sean Lock and Katherine Ryan taking on Jon Richardson and David Mitchell. Nick Helm is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley does the adding up.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits France to find out whether a glass of red wine a day keeps the doctor away, while Jimmy Doherty looks at the growing popularity of venison and how large amounts of it are now imported from New Zealand. Plus, Matt Tebbutt explores the production of skimmed milk, asking how dairy farmers get exactly the right amount of fat into every pint.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit petrol-head Kim in Hampshire, the owner of an accident-damaged 1995 Nissan Skyline GT-R. The team take on the challenge of transforming her Japanese supercar into a street racer's dream.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fiery Brazilian Rosie hosts the final meal in Peterborough, but her brutally honest critiques have ruffled a few feathers throughout the week, leaving her guests in picky moods.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps couple Richard and Felicity Arcelli search for a second home in the Coimbra region of Portugal, with the pair hoping to find a renovation project within their £40,000 budget that can be transformed into a permanent residence.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Surrey couple Brenda and Nick Kennett are looking for a family holiday home in the Correze region of France, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential properties within their budget of £60,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on another excavation, searching for Liberty's first silk factory in south London. The archaeologists try to re-create the 19th-century techniques of dyeing and printing that would have been used - and the frustrating dig finally yields results on the last day.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Bath, Somerset: Death in the Crescent.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts visit Bath's Royal Crescent, where they go in search of a Roman cemetery and the remains of the Fosse Way. Their quest is hampered by torrential rain and an unexpected Victorian cellar, but after three days of hard digging, they still hope to come up trumps.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team work on a 1963 Alfa Romeo Giulia Spider that has been kept in a dusty barn in Essex after its owner's plans to restore it were interrupted by the onset of a serious medical condition.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier puppy called Rex receives treatment for a badly deformed elbow, and the team carry out a complicated procedure to realign the bones. Meanwhile, a cross-breed called Piggy with spinal problems leaves its family facing a difficult decision, and Noel devises an unorthodox cure for a stray cat with a badly fractured leg.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The pets with problems this week include a rare breed of bulldog called Cyrus, who has multiple issues, a lame husky named Ghost, and a Maltese-bichon frise cross suffering from seizures. Plus, Bucklersbury Bear, a huge Newfoundland, finds a new lease of life post-surgery - in the water.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Bill Bailey takes his dog out in the Lake District, Sarah Parish is in the New Forest with her border terrier and Ben Fogle is in Dungeness with his Labrador.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: Diane raises eyebrows while settling in at her new firm, and Maia continues to deal with the fallout from her family's financial dealings. Christine Baranski and Rose Leslie star.(n)

programme.title: Finding My Twin Stranger
programme.desc: A documentary offering an insight into the social media-fuelled phenomenon of people seeking to find their twin stranger. In a unique experiment, seven non-related pairs agree to undergo a series of cutting-edge tests to uncover the science behind twin-like similarities in complete strangers, aiming to prove if these shared similar attributes are more than sheer coincidence.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn compete against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters with `help' from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: When Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Florida Frenzy. In spring 2012 beachgoers along Floridas Mid-Atlantic coast are under attack by what some believe to be a rogue shark. In just 24 hours, three people are savaged while surfing just off shore. Authorities try to stem the blood shed by closing beaches, but only weeks later the attacks continue and each is more severe than the last. While the publics fear grows with each vicious encounter, experts struggle to understand what has triggered the attacks. As the evidence piles up, it soon becomes clear that all is not as it seems(n)

programme.title: Built for the Kill
programme.desc: Grizzly Bear. Grizzly bears are 1000 pounds of muscle, teeth, and claw. Grizzly cubs are just 1 pound of blind, toothless fluff. Built for the Kill: Grizzly Bear follows the transformation of a helpless cub into an accomplished killer, exposing real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The young bear hones its hunting skills over three years of intensive trainingand the lessons are hard. Only the strongest survive to face off in an epic battle against its mortal enemy: the wolf. Its the ultimate showdown between two deadly rivals, confirming why the grizzly bear is truly Built for the Kill(n)

programme.title: Built for the Kill
programme.desc: Wolf. The big bad wolf is 100 pounds of muscle and teeth, but it's born blind, deaf and weighs just one pound. Built for the Kill: Wolf follows the transformation of a helpless pup into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The wolf hones its hunting skills over about two years of intensive training-and the lessons are hard. Only the strongest survive to become leader of the pack, facing off in an epic battle against the mountain lion-an animal nicknamed the perfect predator. It's the ultimate showdown, confirming why the wolf is truly Built for the Kill(n)

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Built to Kill. In the second part of this two-parter Grissom investigates the murder of an aging rockstar who is found dead in his kitchen with an exact replica of the crime scene on the counter next to him. Meanwhile, Catherine probes her own abduction and learns that someone may be targeting her family(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Toe Tags. Las Vegas-based forensic drama. In this episode, each case is linked by the victims as they 'wake up' to find themselves in the morgue(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Fannysmackin'. Two people are viciously beaten, one of them fatally, just five blocks apart in a shady part of town. As the CSIs investigate, more beatings are reported nearby, one of which is witnessed by Greg. His decision to intervene leads to extreme consequences. Later, another similar assault occurs in a different part of town and the CSIs must determine whether it is related to their cases or not(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Double-Cross. Grissom and Sara may be secret lovers, but they still find ways to surprise each other like when their religious beliefs surface when two nuns find a body of a woman crucified on a makeshift cross. The woman was found in a church where the priest may be a man of sin instead of a man of God(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Burn Out. Two boys are reported missing and a pedophile who lives in their neighbourhood becomes the primary suspect after he is injured in a house fire, apparently set by a local seeking revenge for the boys' disappearance. The investigation reveals that one of the boys lives with a rough grandfather who doesn't seem too worried that his grandson is missing(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Post Mortem. After a woman dying of cancer is murdered in her home, the killer later returns to leave a miniature exact replica of the crime scene. It's similar to the one found at the murder scene of a slain rock star weeks before, indicating that a serial killer is at work. In court, Greg testifies at an inquest held to determine his culpability in the death of a teenager he accidentally killed(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Happenstance. Twins who are unaware of each other's existence are murdered in different parts of town, and the CSIs must establish the connection - if any - between the killings(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Living Legend. The remains of Mickey Dunn, a wanted Las Vegas mobster who disappeared in the mid 1970s, are fished out of Lake Mead with a bullet hole in the head. Soon afterwards, a wheelchair-bound man is murdered and a photo found on his body shows the victim with Dunn and three other men. Dunn and the victim have Xs on their faces. It quickly becomes apparent that the other three men may also be targets(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Loco Motives. A man incriminates himself when he falls in cement while trying to transport his wife's dead body. Meanwhile, Grissom investigates the third murder connected to a serial killer who leaves replica models of his crime scenes(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Leaving Las Vegas. Catherine testifies in a murder trial in which a man is accused of murdering his own mother three years ago, but the suspect is found not guilty. Catherine, however, believes he did commit the crime and that he may also have killed two other people, so she sets out to find the other victims. Catherine's probe leads to a small Nevada town where an elderly woman and her daughter were fatally stabbed and shot three years earlier. Back at the lab, Grissom prepares to leave on a four-week sabbatical(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Sweet Jane. Catherine investigates the murder of a runaway teen whose naked body is found in a desert lot behind a hotel. Helping with the case is Mike Keppler an experienced CSI from Baltimore who is the newest hire on the day shift but is filling in temporarily on the night shift since Grissom is on sabbatical. Their investigation reveals the dead girl may be the victim of a serial killer whose slayings may go back decades(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Built to Kill. In the second part of this two-parter Grissom investigates the murder of an aging rockstar who is found dead in his kitchen with an exact replica of the crime scene on the counter next to him. programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Inside the GPO
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 100th anniversary of the Easter Rising by going behind the scenes at the GPO, Ireland's busiest post office. Perhaps best known for serving as the Dublin headquarters of the uprising's leaders back in 1916, the historic building on O'Connel Street has been home to An Post since 1984, and currently staffed by 950 people responsible for everything from co-ordinating mail delivery, to keeping the facilities suitably tidy. The series begins with an introduction to cleaner Sue Gannon and patrolman Philip Freer, best friends who started working at the GPO on the same day back in 1997, and branch manager Shay Cullen, who hopes to make the GPO the leading office in the An Post league tables following a dismal performance two years ago.(n)

programme.title: A Week to My Wedding
programme.desc: Another couple allow cameras to follow the final preparations for their wedding. programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Chesterfield.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Chesterfield, Derbyshire, to help Lisa and Richard Watson. With an expanding family and a young daughter who requires 24-hour care, builder Richard has not been able to complete an extension he started, but along with support from the building trade and local community, the team hopes to lift the strain on the family.(n)

programme.title: Modern Times
programme.desc: Documentary about the characters who live and work in the area of central London, which is famous for being the most coveted square on the Monopoly board and is home to Claridge's hotel and Christie's auction house. The film reveals a world of surprises and deep contrasts, including an estate agent selling multimillion-pound mansions, cafe owners hanging on to their livelihoods by their fingernails, an NHS doctor whose patients range from billionaires to people on benefits, an upmarket resident who dresses in Victorian clothing and a cabbie living in social housing.(n)

programme.title: Inside Claridge's
programme.desc: Regular guest Alexander, Crown Prince of Yugoslavia, returns to stay in the suite in which he was born in 1945. There are also visits by actress Joan Collins, QI host Stephen Fry and the Emperor of Japan, as well as 85-year-old former bookmaker Gerry Parker, who has breakfasted at Claridge's for the past 40 years. General manager Thomas Kochs takes any change very seriously and oversees every decision necessary - from new alarm clocks to a £10million renovation plan.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Between 1976 and 1979, the community of Isla Vista in California was terrorised by serial killer Thor Nis Christiansen, who was caught and sentenced to life imprisonment after a fifth intended victim escaped and identified him in a Hollywood bar. This programme examines Christiansen's character through the first-hand accounts and testaments of the people who knew him best, while detectives, journalists and criminal psychologists also offer an insight into the motives that drove him to kill.(n)

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A young man becomes violently ill and dies soon after eating a fish sandwich, leaving the medic to determine whether it was the result of a rare and lethal form of food poisoning or an unlikely killer. Plus, a woman is killed in a car accident with a drunk driver and the autopsy reveals several devastating clues that she may have played a key role in her own tragic death.(n)

programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple find the perfect country house in north Wales with a budget of £450,000. Now their children have grown up, they have decided to sell their home of 28 years. They hope to move to a property with enough land to grow vegetables and keep chickens, as well as plenty of space to accommodate the family for visits.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Conwy.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team travel to a village in Conwy, north Wales, to help a widower finish building his home. Since the death of his wife and being diagnosed with cancer, David Williams has been unable to work on the property and lives in a caravan with his young daughter Erica - so the crew helps to make the house habitable with the support of the local community and traders.(n)

programme.title: Inside Asprey: Luxury by Royal Appointment
programme.desc: The daily workings of the high-end London designer, which has supplied jewellery to the royal family since the reign of Queen Victoria. Over one summer on New Bond Street, the sales team tempts VIP customers with one-of-a-kind, gem-encrusted handbags selling for an average price of £33,000, while in the workshop above, silversmiths are seen making much of Asprey's luxury merchandise by hand. The programme also highlights the challenge of crafting a three-piece jewellery suite to hit the shop floor on schedule.(n)

programme.title: Inside Claridge's
programme.desc: Thirty delegations from around the world arrive to stay at the hotel for the duration of the Olympics, with the red carpet being rolled out five times a day for heads of state. World-famous Danish eatery Noma sets up a pop-up restaurant in the ballroom and Claridge's chefs are faced with providing Nordic-foraged food to thousands of guests who have paid £195 each. A couple fly in from Atlanta for the wedding of their dreams and a butler prepares a suite for one of the hotel's most valued guests, bringing furniture, hat boxes and 20 suits out of storage for just one night. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Psychological profiles of Wesley Shermantine and Loren Herzog. In 1984, the childhood friends embarked upon a drug-fuelled killing spree that terrorised their rural Californian community for 15 years. Psychologists and criminology experts analyse their motives and examine whether their upbringings contributed to their crimes.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The teams investigates when a bomb-disposal squad is attacked and the culprit threatens to detonate additional hidden explosive devices unless arsonist Jason Duclair is released from prison. programme.desc: Following the work of police officers in New Zealand, featuring behind-the-scenes access to cases and revealing new information about high profile crimes. Hosted and narrated by Detective Sergeant Rob Lemoto.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the team are left completely in the dark when Hetty goes rogue, while the mole kidnaps one of the agents. Crime drama, starring Linda Hunt.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The US embassy in Latvia comes under attack from a group of extremists and Angus and the team have to deal with the situation armed only with a chisel and a book of matches.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross investigates the violent and corrupt world of elephant poaching in Mozambique. If the slaughter continues at its current rate, the animal will be extinct in the country within five years, so he goes undercover to expose the traders who will sell ivory for export to the Far East. He discovers how weak the official response to the crisis has been and also reveals how China's growing prosperity increases demand.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former British ambassador to the USA presents a guide to the forces that drive New York City, and examines the importance of money, faith and fashion in the Big Apple. He also meets several of the city's luminaries, including broadcaster Barbara Walters, mayor Michael Bloomberg, hedge fund manager Richard Hurowitz and Bruce Upbin, managing editor of business journal Forbes Magazine.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates the balance of power in Rome and discovers how the city has been affected by the end of Silvio Berlusconi's government. He also explores the influence of organised crime in the Italian capital and speaks to journalist Myrta Merlino, fashion designer and politician Santo Versace and Pietro Grasso, the head of the city's anti-Mafia crime unit.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat visits Los Angeles to investigate how America's entertainment industry is faring in the 21st century, and meets Ron Meyer, president of Universal Studios. He also explores the city's vast social and economic divides, and discovers how homelessness and gang culture affect its residents.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As a response to the strong challenge of the Republicans, President Bartlet asks Leo to organise the Democratic National Convention in the hope of bringing stability to the party. The vice president puts a proposal to Santos, and the president is troubled by problems in space. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Vice President Russell, Hoynes and Santos are in the running for presidential nominee at the Democratic Party National Convention. President Bartlet has to decide whether to launch the secret defence shuttle to rescue the trapped astronauts.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush reopens the investigation into a teenage girl's murder when a prison inmate hoping to bargain for a reduced sentence hints that the wrong man could be behind bars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctor defies orders when he investigates a four-year-old patient's cause of death, but his obsession lands him in trouble with the new dean of medicine. Meanwhile, a 14-year-old girl's symptoms worsen, and Park tries to force Chase into admitting the reason behind his recent desire to look good.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Movie star Russell Berke is stabbed while shadowing Danny as research for his next role as a New York detective. Frank worries about the findings of a report revealing the rank and file don't feel any personal connection to their police commissioner and decides to make a surprise tour of the precincts to try to appear more personable. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. CJ is interviewed by White House counsel, Donna asks Josh for a job and Santos questions his choice of Leo as running mate. Martin Sheen and Bradley Whitford star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A grand jury is convened to investigate the military shuttle leak, and Vinick is in charge of smoothing things over as the campaign's focus switches to national security. Santos, however, is forced to distance himself from events while remaining loyal to the administration. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A frail mother consumed with guilt asks Rush to reopen the investigation into the murder of her gay son so the killer can be brought to justice before she dies. As the detective moves forward with the case, she learns about the poor treatment of homosexual victims by police in the 1960s. Detective drama, starring Kathryn Morris and John Finn.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A prosecutor suffers from what he believes to be cardiac arrest during an interrogation at the witness stand. The team's preliminary diagnosis is hyper-anxiety, but when Adams and Park investigate the patient's home and find a hidden arsenal of firearms, they uncover a more alarming and deep-seated psychological disorder. Park also begins to emerge out of her social shell, while Foreman's lack of romantic relationships piques the interest of Taub and Chase. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The suspect in a murder trial holds Erin and the rest of her courtroom at gunpoint and Danny becomes the lead hostage negotiator as he tries to save his sister. Jamie goes against his lieutenant's direct orders and accompanies a traumatised child to hospital, leading to a suspension for his disobedience, and Frank has to decide what punishment needs to be levied against his youngest son.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer cooperation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers, and green ants pulling together to build a nest.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs' ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Despite not having jurisdiction, Frank intervenes when diplomatic immunity complicates a child abuse case for Danny and Baez.(n)

programme.title: Midnight Sun
programme.desc: Kahina is held captive by a confused and unstable Bangkok Jori, and Kimmo and his colleagues are put on notice when they receive a revealing video.(n)

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: AJ is called into the principal's office with his parents when he turns up drunk at the gym, having stolen the church sacramental wine. Tony turns to Dr Melfi for assurance that his son is not doomed, and reminisces about his own childhood. Drama, starring James Gandolfini and Lorraine Bracco.(n)

programme.title: Fortitude
programme.desc: The people of Fortitude take matters into their own hands. Dan seeks his own vengeance, but there may still be a demon among the herd.(n)

programme.title: How To Change The World
programme.desc: Documentary charting the rise of environmentalism and exploring how a group of activists on a fishing boat in Canada evolved into the world-famous charitable organisation Greenpeace. The small band of idealists were led by inspirational journalist Bob Hunter and protested against the atomic bomb in 1970s Canada.(n)

programme.title: Alan Partridge's Scissored Isle
programme.desc: One-off, spoof documentary in which Steve Coogan's perennially over-reaching broadcaster heads to the nebulous `north' to see how the other half live. Seeking to make amends for a controversial on-air gaffe, in which Alan apparently managed to offend anyone who considers themselves a `northerner', Norwich's finest sets out to immerse himself in the lives of the very people he slighted, as he investigates what he refers to as the `schasm' between the UK's haves and the have-nots, perhaps even transforming himself into a sought-after TV star in the process.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham relives its glory days by hosting a vintage ships race and heritage festival, and a local toy-shop owner faces a difficult decision.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: Having unearthed the secrets of five of the world's most influential cities, former diplomat Christopher Meyer returns home to London for the concluding programme. He meets Russian-born media tycoon Evgeny Lebedev, who talks about the state of the newspaper business and its influence on government. Meyer then explores the modern face of politics in the English capital with former MP and author Louise Mensch, before chatting to Mayor Boris Johnson, who explains why London is simply the greatest city in the world.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. CJ is interviewed by White House counsel, Donna asks Josh for a job and Santos questions his choice of Leo as running mate. Martin Sheen and Bradley Whitford star.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Three weeks into the presidential campaign, Santos pulls off a coup that raises his approval ratings, while Vinick ignores warnings of a possible assassination brought to him by an eager NSA agent. The pair compete to bring each other down as they deliver their messages of the week. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: When his peace plan for the Middle East is jeopardised by the assassination of a Palestinian leader, President Bartlet insists on attending the funeral despite concerns over his security. Meanwhile, CJ receives disturbing news from a member of the intelligence community. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Allison Janney.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush receives an anonymous phone call from a man who claims to have murdered his grandmother many years previously and buried her body in the basement of his former home. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An Alzheimer's patient takes part in a clinical trial, but unexpected side-effects trigger an explosive temper and expose a conflict between him and his wife. Meanwhile, House confronts new boss Foreman, and Wilson treats a patient who claims to be in a chaste marriage. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate when a teenage girl dies after being hit by an underground train and uncover evidence that the girl had been a victim of cyber bulling. Frank clashes with the newly appointed inspector general of the NYPD after Erin brings forward evidence that Jamie's partner Eddie may have lied about the details of her first arrest. Guest starring Bebe Neuwirth (Frasier).(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: Alan Partridge's Scissored Isle
programme.desc: One-off, spoof documentary in which Steve Coogan's perennially over-reaching broadcaster heads to the nebulous `north' to see how the other half live. programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: New series. Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon set off on a coast-to-coast road trip through Spain, starting with the picturesque port village of Getaria.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.sub-title: What Will We Do This Time About Adam?.
programme.desc: Adam shares some news with Hannah, while Jessa spends a day alone.(n)

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete has a new gig as a warm-up comic on the Rachel Ray Show, but finds himself caught up in a web of lies after an unexpected call from Leif's wife.(n)

programme.title: Border Security: Australia's Front Line
programme.desc: The work of Australia's customs and immigration officials, following the procedures they use to protect the country's borders from drug smugglers, illegal immigrants, potential terrorists, harmful pests and exotic diseases.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Dog handler Darryl gets a nasty surprise when he tries to break up a pub fight in Exeter city centre, and the Ashburton Tactical Aid Group carries out raids on two flats. The road crime unit is forced to box in a dangerous driver on a dual carriageway, while American officers are attacked by turkeys.(n)

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: A mystery involving a former mentor lures Holmes back to London, where he is reunited with his estranged brother Mycroft. Watson hopes the man will be able to shed light on her partner's childhood, but Sherlock suspects his sibling has dubious intentions toward her. Guest starring Rhys Ifans and Sean Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom investigates an apparent electrocution at a casino, but discovers the case is a hoax staged to distract attention from the theft of valuable Japanese antiques. Meanwhile, Catherine and Warrick delve into the death of a woman who had been part of a group pretending to live like vampires, but was thrown out for taking things too seriously and drinking human blood.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A suspected serial killer wakes from a four-year coma claiming not to remember who he is or anything about the crimes he is accused of committing. The team uses a technique known as brain fingerprinting to determine whether he is telling the truth. Crime drama, starring Joe Mantegna and AJ Cook.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When several unconnected people are shot at point-blank range in New York, the team is called to investigate whether it is the work of a serial killer or more than one murderer.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: Officers search a shipment of doors and discover a large concealment of drugs and ammunition destined for Devon, and in Bristol, the team receives a tip-off and pays a visit to suspected cigarette smugglers. programme.title: Nothing to Declare

programme.desc: The Venezuelan president is killed in an earthquake, so Elizabeth works to stop a power grab by his son. Meanwhile, the secretary's brother feels obliged to help the relief effort.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents hear that Morgan has been abducted, and while they try to identify the perpetrators, their colleague is being tortured - but has no idea why. Danny Glover guest stars.(n)

programme.desc: A new witness comes forward claiming to have information about the 1984 shooting of a well-known physician, prompting Lilly to reopen the case. She is soon led into the world of gambling when it becomes apparent the respected doctor had been hiding a secret from his family. Starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Scandal
programme.desc: Huck proves his loyalty to Olivia when she asks him to complete a difficult task following the discovery of new information about the assassination.(n)

Two Chinese visitors squabble among themselves when officers discover prohibited items in their bags, and things get messy when searching a large container.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A woman returning from a trip to China has a tantrum, and officers want to know why she has business cards for a Sydney brothel and passports for three unknown Chinese women. An elderly New Zealander says he has turned over a new leaf, but his track record may stop him from attending an important family event.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A pair of Mueller's gibbons develop a taste for life in the treetops, while three endangered golden-cheeked gibbons move into the enclosure next door. Meanwhile, a specialist doctor is called in when Freddy's bowel complaint fails to improve.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison Cronin visits Dao Tien island in Vietnam, the site of Monkey World's foreign sanctuary for endangered primates. Meanwhile, the team learns that two rare monkeys are being kept in a theme park outside Ho Chi Minh City, and tries to get them freed.(n)

programme.desc: Airport security staff discover a hoard of deadly weapons on an X-ray, a Korean man is found to be using someone else's passport, and a passenger is caught carrying suspicious looking statues in his luggage.(n)

Sheffield's Willett claimed a shock win with a five-under-par 67 last year, as 2015 champion Jordan Spieth crumbled during a thrilling final round. Willett was tied for ninth place following the opening round in 2016, four shots off the blistering early pace set by Spieth, who was out on his own after a six-under-par 66.(n)

programme.title: The Masters - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the traditional curtain-raiser to the first Major of the year, which is held on a par 27 nine-hole course within the grounds of Augusta National. Since the inception of this semi-social event in 1960, no golfer has ever won the par three contest and the Masters in the same year. Jimmy Walker was the victorious player last year when he shot a course-record total of eight under par, but could only finish tied for 29th in the main tournament.(n)

programme.title: The Masters - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening day from the Augusta National in Georgia, where Englishman Danny Willett begins his defence of the year's first Major. Sheffield's Willett claimed a shock win with a five-under-par 67 last year, as 2015 champion Jordan Spieth crumbled during a thrilling final round. Willett was tied for ninth place following the opening round in 2016, four shots off the blistering early pace set by Spieth, who was out on his own after a six-under-par 66.(n)
