programme.title: Unsullied
programme.desc: Track star Reagan (Murray Gray) must use her training to escape from two violent kidnappers after she is abducted when her car breaks down in rural Florida. Unsullied is the debut feature from former pro-football player Simeon Rice(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: Nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence(n)

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: Steve Martin plays Bobby Bowfinger, a would-be movie producer and charlatan who desperately needs a hit film to repay his debts. Bringing together a cast of oddballs, he dupes superstar actor Eddie Murphy into starring in his low-budget picture. Sharp comedy, with an experienced cast including Heather Graham(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan named Ella is treated cruelly by her stepmother and stepsisters, who force her to do menial chores. However, her life changes forever when she meets a prince in this charming take on the classic fairy tale(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied at school and neglected at home, Jess Aarons and Leslie Burke escape into the woods, where Leslie opens Jess's mind to the amazing kingdom of Terabithia. It's a secret land where they reign supreme among the giants, ogres and other fantastical creatures they create(n)

programme.title: Honey 2
programme.desc: Recently released from juvenile detention after a brush with the law, talented dancer Maria Ramirez has returned to her gritty Bronx roots to rebuild her life. When a rare night out at a local dance club gives her an opportunity to let loose, Maria's killer moves catch the eye of Brandon, a Rec Center volunteer who invites her to help him transform a group of gifted but undisciplined dancers into a competitive crew. This might be her big chance at creating a new and meaningful life(n)

programme.title: Spread
programme.desc: An unemployed drifter gets by living off a succession of wealthy older lovers, the latest of whom is a successful Los Angeles attorney. However, his carefree existence takes an unexpected turn when he falls in love with an equally directionless waitress(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: Nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest
programme.desc: Training Day director Antoine Fuqua takes viewers on a dark ride through the streets of Brooklyn, following three New York Police officers as they wrestle with temptation, loyalty, and duty while attempting to uphold the law and deal with the pressures of the job. Eddie Dugan (Richard Gere) is days away from retirement, but he's been burnt-out for years. Unable to remember why he signed up for the job in the first place, all Eddie can think about is retreating to his fishing cabin in Connecticut, and forgetting the horrors that he's seen during his decades on the job. At the same time, undercover narcotics cop Clarence "Tango" Butler (Don Cheadle) is right in the thick of it. As hard as he tries to quit, however, his superiors always find a way of keeping him on the job. Much like Dugan, he's lost sight of his priorities, and these days Tango's loyalties seem to lie more with notorious inner-city drug dealer Caz (Wesley Snipes) than with the boys in blue. And Tango isn't the only cop who's being drawn to the dark side of the law; narcotics officer Sal Procida's (Ethan Hawke) wife is currently pregnant with twins, and he's barely making enough to keep his family afloat. When Sal learns that his wife is at risk of losing their unborn children, desperation drives him to consider unethical means of ensuring financial stability. In seven days, the lives of all three officers will converge at one crime scene as the NYPD attempts to clean up the BK projects, the epicenter of lawlessness in the highest-crime precinct(n)

programme.title: Black Sails
programme.desc: XXXVIII. Flint makes a final push to bring England to its knees; Silver seals his fate; Rackham confronts Rogers; and Nassau is changed forever(n)

programme.title: The Interpreter
programme.desc: In the UN building in New York, interpreter Silvia claims that African dictator Zuwanie is about to be assassinated. Zuwanie's FBI minder Keller doesn't believe Silvia, until the conspirators try to kill her(n)

programme.title: Black Sails
programme.desc: XXXVIII. Flint makes a final push to bring England to its knees; Silver seals his fate; Rackham confronts Rogers; and Nassau is changed forever(n)

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: Compelling Civil War drama based on a true story. A regiment of black soldiers, led by a rookie white officer, fight both the Confederacy and racism within their own ranks(n)

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: Irish playwright Martin McDonagh brings crackling dialogue and pitch-black humour to this tale about hit men laying low after a botched job. Exiled to picturesque Bruges, Belgium, partners Ken and Ray kill time in pubs, museums and medieval churches while awaiting word from their sociopathic boss. The fun is over when he calls with a troubling new assignment(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimsby
programme.desc: A working-class British soccer hooligan discovers that his long-lost brother is now a well-mannered superspy. When their reunion at a charity event causes the latter to botch a crucial mission, the two men must team up to defeat a terrorist organization(n)

programme.title: The Blackout Experiments
programme.desc: A look at an interactive horror show known as "Blackout," in which willing participants are subjected to terrifying and painful experiences. This documentary profiles those who repeatedly engage in Blackout, examining what motivates them to do so. Directed by Rich Fox(n)

programme.title: Son of Saul
programme.desc: Saul, a Hungarian prisoner, is assigned to burn the corpses of his own people in one of the Auschwitz Crematoriums. He finds moral survival when he tries to secure a proper Jewish burial of his son(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widow named Marnie relocates to L.A. to be closer to her daughter Lori, a Hollywood screenwriter. While Lori frets about her mom's smothering ways, Marnie keeps getting involved in the lives of others in this charming comedy-drama: She dates an ex-cop, helps an Apple Store employee study for school and pays for a lesbian wedding(n)

programme.title: Robert Klein Still Can't Stop His Leg
programme.desc: The life and career of comedian Robert Klein are the focus of this documentary, which includes interviews with Jerry Seinfeld, Jon Stewart, Richard Lewis and more(n)

programme.title: I Am Wrath
programme.desc: An engineer with a dark past (John Travolta) seeks revenge for his wife's murder, and teams with an old friend (Christopher Meloni) to locate the killers after the crooked cops assigned to the case fail to bring them to justice. Chuck Russell directed this action thriller(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: A Rhode Island state trooper (Jim Carrey) with a split personality tries to protect a lovely con artist (Renee Zellweger) from foul play in this hilarious film by the Farrelly brothers. The situation becomes even more complicated when each of the officer's personalities begins to fall for the young woman. Chris Cooper, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee, Jerod Mixon(n)

programme.title: Making a Killing: Guns, Greed, and the NRA
programme.desc: A study of the impact of gun sales in the United States(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Wildly inventive dark comedy about a puppeteer who gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office. Later, a love triangle forms when he and his wife both have affairs with one of his coworkers while inhabiting Malkovich's body(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: In the frightmarish tradition of "The Blair Witch Project" comes this nerve-jangling chiller. Jennifer Carpenter is outstanding as a TV reporter who gets confined to a quarantined apartment complex in Los Angeles that houses a mysterious, scary secret. It isn't long before she learns why someone was "screaming bloody murder." A remake of the 2007 Spanish horror film "REC." Directed by John Erick Dowdle, who cowrote the script with Drew Dowdle. Steve Harris, Jay Hernandez, Johnathon Schaech(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones(n)

programme.title: Red Hook Summer
programme.desc: In this affectionate slice of life, a boy from Atlanta spends a summer in Brooklyn under the watchful eye of his grandfather, a bishop at a local church, and he connects with a pretty girl who expands his understanding of the world(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: George Jung was the Boston kid who became America's biggest cocaine supplier, in league with Colombian Pablo Escobar. Director Ted Demme's final feature is a rags-to-riches morality tale of power and pitfalls(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven
programme.desc: (2005) Ridley Scott's epic historical drama is set in the 12th century at the Crusader defence of Jerusalem. Orlando Bloom plays Balian de Ibelin, a village blacksmith and the illegitimate son of Godfrey de Ibelin (Liam Neeson), a crusader knight returned from the Holy Land. He persuades Balian that riches await those who go to defend the city and its Christian King Baldwin (Edward Norton) against the attack of Saladin (Ghassan Massoud), who seeks to win the city back for the Muslim faith. Balian, as well as falling for Baldwin's sister Sibylla (Eva Green), finds himself a power broker between the two factions, with the fate of the city in his hands. In English, and Arabic, Latin and Italian with English subtitles. M,W,R,S,,HD(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones(n)

programme.title: Truth
programme.desc: The film focuses on the last few days of news anchor Dan Rather and producer Mary Mapes, after questions were raised about their controversial report on the special privilege and connections of President Bush in order to avoid fighting in the Vietnam War(n)

programme.title: Aloft
programme.desc: A mother reunites with her estranged son, whom she abandoned two decades earlier after a strange encounter with a faith healer(n)

programme.title: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the acclaimed graphic novel, a precocious teenage girl living in 1970s San Francisco tries to understand the connection between sex and love after she seduces her bohemian mother's boyfriend(n)

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Highly acclaimed drama about a junkie, Bob Hughes, and his 'crew' of fellow addicts, who drift through 1970s North America robbing hospitals and pharmacies to feed their increasingly large habits. When one of his sidekicks dies, Bob decides to go straight - but his girlfriend has problems following him into the drug-free world. The film features a memorable cameo from William S Burroughs(n)

programme.title: Kill the Irishman
programme.desc: This incredible biopic follows Cleveland union rep Danny Greene (Ray Stevenson), who earned notoriety in the mid-'70s for his willingness to defy the Italian mob. A former Mafia enforcer, Greene managed to survive numerous assassination attempts, and eventually he dealt a devastating blow to organized-crime syndicates across the U.S(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: George Jung was the Boston kid who became America's biggest cocaine supplier, in league with Colombian Pablo Escobar. Director Ted Demme's final feature is a rags-to-riches morality tale of power and pitfalls(n)

programme.title: 21 Grams
programme.desc: A tragic accident brings together the destinies of Paul, a gravely ill heart patient, Jack, an ex-con who has found God and Cristina, a loving wife and mother(n)

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars in the incredible true story of a rebel German army officer who led a plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler and overthrow his ruthless Nazi regime during World War II. programme.title: The Man Who Wasn't There
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton is a barber in a sleepy '40s town whose wife (Frances McDormand) is having an affair with her boss James Gandolfini. But when he's offered a get-rich-quick scheme, his plans to raise the money lead to blackmail, murder, death-row for his wife, an expensive city lawyer (Tony Shalhoub) and then, by a savage irony, his own appointment with the electric chair for a crime he didn't commit. The Coen Brothers' Oscar-nominated Hitchcockian tribute to the film noir genre is sparked with humour, darkness and outstanding performances(n)

programme.desc: Kevin Kline and Sigourney Weaver star in this acclaimed drama about discontent in 1970s suburban Connecticut. Joan Allen, Jamey Sheridan, Christina Ricci, Elijah Wood, Adam Hann-Byrd, Tobey Maguire(n)

programme.title: Stone
programme.desc: A convicted arsonist schemes to get out of prison by convincing his debauched wife to seduce his retirement-ready parole officer in director John J. Curran's adaptation of a play by Angus MacLachlan (who also authored the screenplay). His career as a parole officer winding down after years of service, Jack Mabry (Robert De Niro) reluctantly accepts an assignment to reassess inmate Gerald "Stone" Creeson's (Edward Norton) case for an upcoming parole hearing. Convicted of setting a fire to make the murder of his grandparents look like an accidental death, Stone will do anything to get out from behind bars, and his wife, Lucetta (Milla Jovovich), is willing to do whatever it takes to help secure her husband's freedom -- including seducing Jack. Meanwhile, Jack's devoted wife, Madylyn (Frances Conroy), has suffered with the emotional weight of her husband's demanding job for far too long(n)

programme.title: Wolf Totem
programme.desc: In this exciting adventure set in 1960s China, a student from Beijing is sent to teach a nomadic tribe in Mongolia. While there, he cares for and adopts a wolf cub, and their bond causes him to see the world in a new light(n)

programme.title: The Bronze
programme.desc: Once a beloved celebrity who won an Olympic bronze medal in gymnastics while performing with a ruptured Achilles, Hope Ann Greggory (Melissa Rauch) is now a washed-up has-been relying on her past fame to get by. However, opportunity knocks when she is offered the chance to train a promising teenage tumbler (Haley Lu Richardson) in exchange for a financial windfall. Greggory is soon torn between the money and her desire to remain the most famous person in her hometown. Gary Cole, Thomas Middleditch, Sebastian Stan, and Cecily Strong co-star. Directed by Bryan Buckley(n)

programme.title: Easy Money
programme.desc: Comedy with the great Rodney Dangerfield in line to get a $10 million inheritance ... if he can give up smoking, drinking and gambling for a whole year!(n)

programme.title: Dysfunktional Family
programme.desc: Comedian Eddie Griffin delivers a set of his outrageous standup comedy and introduces his fans to the family who helped inspire his work in this documentary. In DysFunKtional Family, Griffin talks about race, sex, cats, dogs, slavery, terrorism, Michael Jackson, and several of the more eccentric members of his family during a sold-out live show. In between bits, Griffin takes us on a tour of his home town of Kansas City, where we get to meet his mother, who has a remarkable enthusiasm for corporal punishment; his uncle, who discusses his remarkable enthusiasm for pornography; and another uncle, who proved to be an invaluable help to Griffin's early career despite his drug habit and career as a pimp. DysFunKtional Family was directed by George Gallo, who previously worked with Griffin on the comedy Double Take(n)

programme.desc: A neurotic, twice divorced sci-fi writer moves back in with his mom to solve his personal problems(n)

programme.title: Alpha and Omega
programme.desc: Kate and Humphrey are two mismatched wolves who embark on a cross-country quest to get back home and restore peace in their pack after being relocated thousands of miles away by well-meaning park rangers. Humphrey likes to frolic with friends and play video games with squirrels while disciplined Kate likes to call the shots and hunt caribou. Normally, an omega wolf like Humphrey would never stand a chance with an alpha wolf like Kate, but now they must work together to get back to their natural habitat. programme.title: A Band Called Death
programme.desc: Filmmakers Mark Christopher Covino and Jeff Howlett profile obscure, early-1970s Detroit proto-punk outfit Death, who disbanded before releasing a single album, but who were vindicated nearly 30 years later when their 1974 demo tape was released to much fanfare. Formed by three Detroit siblings six years before the Sex Pistols stormed the airwaves with God Save the Queen, Death's blisteringly aggressive music was initially dismissed by record labels more interested in cashing-in on the glitzy disco craze. As contracts were cancelled and debts mounted, the band that ushered in a dangerous new era of music vanished into obscurity. Three decades later, however, the discovery of Death's only demo reveals just how far ahead of their time the band really was(n)

programme.title: Tuck Everlasting
programme.desc: Natalie Babbitt's award winning book for children comes to the screen in a lavish adaptation from Walt Disney Pictures. Winnie Foster (Alexis Bledel) is a girl in her early teens growing up in the small rural town of Winesap in 1914. Winnie's parents (Victor Garber and Amy Irving) are loving but overprotective, and Winnie longs for a life of greater freedom and adventure. One day, while exploring the nearby woods, Winnie gets lost, but she has the good fortune to happen upon the Tuck Family, who live nearby - mother Mae (Sissy Spacek), father Angus (William Hurt), and sons Jesse (Jonathan Jackson) and Miles (Scott Bairstow). The Tucks are warm and caring people, and Winnie feels right at home with them; she also finds herself developing a serious crush on Jesse, and isn't so sure she wants to return; meanwhile, her parents become increasingly distraught as they search for their missing daughter. But in time Winnie discovers there's a secret behind the seemingly idyllic lives of the Tuck Family; they have discovered a magical spring on their property, and anyone who drinks from it will never grow old and never die. While to Winnie this sounds like a wonderful prospect, the Tucks have come to understand this is as much of a curse as a blessing, especially when she realizes Jesse is considerably older than she is. The Tucks also have to contend with the presence of the sinister Man In The Yellow Suit (Ben Kingsley), who wishes to buy their property and make a fortune from their "fountain of youth." Tuck Everlasting was directed by Jay Russell, who previously directed the acclaimed family film My Dog Skip(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Chicago Shoe Exchange. Although the previous installment "How to Marry a Moron" was officially designated as the final episode of Married. . .With Children, the series actually ended with this "leftover", which aired five weeks after "Moron" on June 9, 1997. Hoping to barter their way towards an expensive massage chair, Al and Griff begin trading off the items in Gary's shoe store--and never mind that those items don't actually belong to them. Meanwhile, Kelly (Christina Applegate) practices her own massage techniques on her unwilling brother Bud (David Faustino). The series' very last image, appropriately enough, is a shot of a chimpanzee dressed like Al Bundy (so there's a difference?)(n)

This "bonding" moment carries over to wives Peg (Katey Sagal) and Marcy (Amanda Bearse), who find themselves united in their hatred for the Mustang project -- and by extension, their husbands. Though they agreed not to exchange gifts for their 16th wedding anniversary, Al (Ed O'Neill) and Peg (Katey Sagal) have characteristically lied to one another. Comes the big day, however, and it looks like Al has forgotten. Actually, Al wanted to buy Peg a present, only to find that his credit card was maxed out -- and wonder or wonders, it's not his fault this time. programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: The Opposite. Although it was not the last episode shot for the show's fifth season -- that would be "The Hamptons," which aired second to last -- it makes sense that "The Opposite" aired last, as several turns of events set the stage for the sixth season. It all starts with George deciding to do the opposite of everything he would normally do. Once he puts the plan into action, the perennial loser suddenly sees things going well for himself. He gets a girlfriend, a job with the Yankees, and finally moves out of his parents house. Meanwhile, Jerry realizes that his luck is "even Steven," Kramer appears on Live! With Regis and Kathy Lee to promote his coffee-table book about coffee tables, and Elaine suddenly can't win, leading her to believe that she has switched places with George. Originally airing May 19, 1994, the fifth-season closer guest starred 3rd Rock From the Sun's French Stewart and featured the first appearance of the faceless George Steinbrenner, voiced by co-creator Larry David(n)
